Keyboard Shortcuts for this dialog:

(N) - Finalize or Start Incursion.

(M) - Navigation Map (Finalize First).

(F) - Go to the Farm (Finalize First).

(Enter) - Close Dialog. (Back To Playing)

(R) - Force Restart. (Finalize and Restart)

Training Panel:
Here you can Upgrade your Goals, Increasing Prizes awarded for conquering them .

Hover the mouse over any Goal in the left for more Information.

Studies Panel:
Here you can Research Technologies to Improve Quest Playing.

Hover the mouse over each one of them for more Information.

You've just finished NEO Demo Version!



Help Kade to get back home.

His fate is in your hands!



There's much more yet to be discovered:



-Extra heroes.

-Much more Perks.

-Improved Graphics.

-Improved Sound Fx and Music.

-Improved Story.

-Secret Areas.

-Powerful Artifacts/Relics.

-And Much, Much More!

Butcher Instructions:


1) Move close to the Butcher.

2) Choose a desired prize by standing on its slot.

3) Bump into the Butcher, matching the rotating arrow with the fixed one to gain prizes.

4) Reward chances are shown as percentages.

5) Time your hit to align the arrows and boost your reward chances.

Every 100 minutes, 5 feathers spawn on the farm. Uncollected feathers are lost when you leave.
Each collected feather reduces the next spawn time by 10 minutes.
Collecting 2 or more starts a combo. Kill monsters during a combo to gain progressively more feathers.

My Diary: I just woke up in this strange forest.
Memories of my life feel like nothing more than a colorless dream.
I need to find a way home...

Tip: From the start, try getting used to moving diagonally!
It'll become very important later in the game.
(Avoid using the regular Arrow Keys since you'll need diagonal steps)

My diary: The most immediate priority when lost in an unknown place is:
FIND DRINKABLE WATER.
People often waste too much time hunting for food and end up dying of dehydration.
My diary: Nature here Looks so strange! What place is this?
My diary: Good news! I found water! At least I'm safe for now...

My Diary: Now that I have access to water, I need to find a way to make fire.
Fire can keep me warm and protect me from the wild Animals at night.

This Square area means that you have a Quest.
Bump against it to select this Quest...

After you have selected this Quest,
(Square changed to Yellow color)
Press M to go back to the Quest dialog and start a new Incursion.

My diary: Where am I?


I don't even know if I am still on planet earth!


This place looks so strange sometimes...

Hint: You need to earn at least:


1) - 25 Bronze trophies.

2) - 15 Silver trophies.

3) - 10 Gold trophies.


In this area to unlock "Plethora I" Quest And Finish this Demo.


As soon as you've got them, click "Unlock Quest" button in the Quest´s Dialog to play it.

TIP: Sometimes Maps May Contain too Much Decoration.
Hold LControl While Playing to Activate Study Mode (Hide Decoration + Zoom Out).

It’s good that you´re progressing!
Notice the Trophies over the Firepit. Keep collecting them!
They´re important so you can Unlock more Quests in the future.
Notice that you can replay any quest over and over as much as you want.

Testers: Try not to feel overwhelmed by the huge amount of information provided in this game.
This is a VERY Complex game, and you should try to learn the ropes step by step.
(Some kind of "Hide Advanced Information" option is planned for the final release.)
There's a great amount of Advanced tricks that may take months to master.

Priorities:
1) At first, just play; don’t worry about details.
2) Learn how the farm and quest unlocking and upgrading system works.
3) Learn how to identify goal prizes to get blueprints and resources for expanding the farm.
4) Learn how to upgrade your studies to make the most out of the quest.

If a message starts with the word "Important," make sure you understand it!

Message for testers:


If you like static puzzles, go for:

Scorpions, Mining, Voodoo, Plague Monsters.


Dynamic puzzles, go for:

Voodoo, Hugger, Spiders, Frog,  Axe, Plague Monsters.


Gates, rowing and Maze are Basic Tutorials.


Winter, Fog and Beach is about Terrain fighting.


All the others are a mixture of Fighting and puzzle.


Pure Stepping, RPG maps, wild monsters and advanced features are found from the second chapter on.


Have Fun!!

Press LShift To Switch to Free Camera Mode (Cubes).

While in Free Camera Mode, Use Movement Keys for navigation.

Press LControl to Change the Camera Zoom.

HOLD RControl Key for a second to Hide Vegetation Layer (Study Mode).

VERY IMPORTANT: All you need to beat a quest and advance through the game is a Bronze trophy!

You can always come back later for silver or gold trophies when you get more experienced...

Quests start becoming much harder from 7th cube on and are not meant to be beaten in a single shot!

So Remember: If it´s getting too hard, Just choose another quest to start playing in the navigation map...

Cubes 1 to 4 are in general, Easy ones.

Cubes 5 to 7 are generally Intermediate.

from 8th up, hard ones.

Hint: Play Laterally!

(Choose another quest to start up if things are getting too hard!)

Warning: If you haven't yet upgraded your stone Maximum Capacity to at least 10 or Higher you won't be able to unlock some quests like "Frogs in Frenzy" and Others.

Just go to the farm and use the "Stone Capacity" blueprint the same way as they were used to build the buildings.

Don't waste your Stone Prizes due to lack of storage Space, They are very important!

Very Important: Keep Upgrading your Stone capacity at the farm.

(More Blueprints found at the "Fire is my Best Friend" Quest or some other Places).

Try not to waste resources due to lack of storage space!

Every resource found in the wilderness counts!!

(Some Quests require specific resources to be played).

If there's a special Message for beginners, here it is:

"Pass the finger training stage and you will be greatly rewarded!"

Remember this before giving up on NEO:
You are not quitting an ordinary game.

"Pass the finger training stage and you will be greatly rewarded!"

At first, the control system may feel challenging. But once you overcome this stage,
a whole new and unprecedented world of gaming will open before you.

"Pass the finger training stage and you will be greatly rewarded!"

Do not give up on NEO until you truly understand it.
Once you move past the initial uncomfortable finger training phase,
you will finally see why NEO belongs to the "Never seen before" game category."

My diary: As the days go by, I'm slowly recovering the memories of my past life.

I just wonder the reason why I ended up here in this weird place...

My Diary: These Giant Yellow Flowers look so good, but I think there´s a catch...

In the last days, I´ve seen quite a few critter corpses near them. I´m starting to believe they are...

...CARNIVOROUS!!! Ouch!!

My diary:
Quote of the day:
"I could pay a million dollars for a Swiss Army knife".

Congratulations!! You've Finished Chapter I!

The real "meaty" Features and monsters can be found from the next chapter on.

Contact the Developer for more info.

This is an intentional Blockade!

The real fun maps are yet to come, you´ve just seen the Introduction part of NEO...

TIP: Conquer 20 Gold Medals to Unlock This last Quest which is a Bonus for Completion!

Master Shortcut List:

(Press F1 while Playing to Display this list).


Enter: Open Objectives Dialog.

C and V: Rotation.

Z: Hurry Up Time.

X: Wait. (Stepping mode).

lShift: Toggle Free Camera mode (Use Move Keys)

lControl: Camera Zoom

LControl (Hold): Study Mode.

Tab: Hide Vegetation.

"\" or "|" or "Backslash" : Quick Puzzle navigation.

F2: Toggle Debug information.

There's a Lot of Variation in this Game!

Every Quest Provides a New Gameplay Style, Monster, Feature, Strategy, Theme, and More.

If You Don't Like a Quest, Don't Give Up. Simply Choose Another Quest to Try Something Completely New...

My Diary: Being stranded makes you talk to objects as if they were your friends.
I even find myself talking to my bow and arrow these days!
I think I need a "Wilson," or maybe a "talking coconut friend," heh...

My Diary: As an Artist, I've always used art as a morale booster in every aspect of my life.
I always believed that there’s a "creative way" to approach even the most tedious task.
Today, I made a decision: I'll stop complaining about my situation here.
Finding my way home is going to be my new hobby, my new job, my new obsession.
I’m going to paint my "Mona Lisa" here…
Finding my way home will be MY NEW ART…

My Diary:

Just a note:
A good thing! (And I’m in need of one.)
I’m gonna have a bunch of unread emails when I get back home! :)

Warning: If you got here, contact the Developer.
This is an intentional Blockade!

The real fun maps are yet to come; you’ve just seen the Introduction part of NEO...

Congratulations on finishing the Second Chapter of the Game!!!

Hint: Try to get more Trophies so you can unlock the "Fishing IV" Quest, a Bonus Quest for those who have conquered most of the Game Trophies.

Welcome to the Fire Lesson. Fire is vital in NEO! 
Pick up the Dome artifact to unlock the Firemaster perk.
Approach a firepit and start lighting!

Some extra maneuvering may be needed to place all 4 logs.

Don't forget to light all 4 firepits before leaving through the gate.

Objective: Light 10 firepits to earn the Bronze Trophy.
Once done:
1)- Defeat all monsters.
2)- Move to the gate to claim your bonuses (important).
3)- Press **Enter** to open the dialog.
4)- Press **Finalize** to complete the quest.

Practice makes perfect! Keep training until you can move and rotate smoothly without much effort.

As soon as you improve, you'll be rewarded with some seriously fun levels!

TIP: You need to be perfectly aligned with the monster in order to shoot it.

Rotation training is the key for survival in the wilderness.


Keys: C and V

Notice the message Above: “Kill 40 monsters: 40 done.” That means your next objective is ready.

Important: Even after completing your objective, it will not be marked as complete until you leave the area by stepping through the gate. 
*The game ONLY SAVES after that!*

Remember: Finishing the task alone is not enough. 
You must exit through the wall to complete the mission. 

Only finalize the game after leaving!!!

Scarabs are deceptively easy to kill, one strike and they collapse into nothing.

…but if one sinks its fangs into you, it burrows into your bloodstream, 
wriggling through every vein until it reaches your organs. 
In mere seconds, it begins feasting from the inside out, leaving nothing but agony and ruin.
TIP: Pull the Lever towards the same direction of the wheel rotation.

A tip for beginners to memorize Hero Rotation:

Imagine your character as a car steering wheel.
(Press C or V to swing.)

Players quit this type of game at first because diagonal movements and rotation can feel difficult. 
Don’t be discouraged. It’s normal to find it tricky in the beginning.

Despite the initial grind, after a little more practice, 
Movement will feel more natural, and a lot of fun awaits.

You have no idea how wild the gameplay becomes as you improve!


Keep my promise: you’ve never seen anything like this! ;-)
Remember: Kill all Monsters to clear the Cube, step through the gate to save your progress, and only then finalize the game.

My diary: There's no thing like being alone for too long. After months all by yourself, you are 
not alone anymore, but with a companion: You. 
The problem is that this "You", start talking to the other "Yous" that are also inside you. 
Every once in a while one of these "you"s need to shut up the rest of the other "You"s because of all the intense internal talking.  
But you never know if this "You" was the real "You" or not... That's the problem...
Kade: Ouch! This Feels Claustrophobic...
Kade: Ninja!!!
These Boots Allow you to kick Monsters! Just Move towards Monsters when you're one tile away from them.
Important: Kicked Monster Only get Damaged when Kicked against Tall Tiles (Forest, Gates, etc).

Diagonal Kick Technique:

1) - Step onto the mud tile.

2) - Move diagonally (NE or NW).

3) - The monster located directly north is kicked toward the north.

4) - This logic applies similarly for any monster positioned directly to the north, south, east, or west of the hero. 

Diagonal movement kicks it in that cardinal direction.

You can Push Monsters over MUD!


Pushed Monsters have their attack and Movement Delayed.

You can also Push a Monster against a barricade to destroy it.

Notice that Pushed Monsters can Only destroy ONE barricade log until he moves away from his occupying tile or 
Destroy another neighbor barricade (without being pushed).
My Diary: Hope all this mud Splatting mess at least will do something good for my skin...
This Vault imposes a limit on how many steps can be taken within a TicTac cycle.

Watch closely—these Scarabs move during the first two beats of the TIC-TAC cycle!
Move your mouse over a Scarab to find out what it's up to

This Vault will pull the hero in and place him on a random tile near a monster that has line of sight to him.

Study the movement pattern carefully before proceeding."

This is The Slayer Plague Monster!


They Generally Appear in the Farm...
The Problem: They Block your Movement.
Bump Against a Single Plague Monster and Nothing Happens...

Bump Against Flocking Plague Monsters, and you will Push him.


(Flocking Definition: Containing One or more Similar monsters in an Adjacent Tile)

TIP: Flocking Monsters Have a Stony Background.

Bump against a Slayer Plague Monster, and he will destroy any other Plague Monster behind.


Important: Rotate towards the Plague Monster located in the Back to Choose the desired Target.

(East Direction in this case)

Diagonally too...


(Remember to Rotate towards the target before Bumping)
Think before proceeding!
TIP: Hover the mouse over a Plague Monster for more info.

This is the Second Plague Monster Type:

The Swapper!
Like Any other Plague Monsters, Swappers in a Group can also be Pushed!

Bump Against a Swapping Plague Monster and He will have it's Position Exchanged with the Monster Behind him.


Swapping Target is Defined by Hero Direction.
Similar monsters Die Altogether when aligned.

This is the Third Creature Type:


The Kickable Plague Monster!

Bump Against a Kickable Monster and it will Slide Towards Hero Direction until an obstacle is found.


Transforms itself in Two new Monster of Random Type after Stopping.

(2 free tiles Required)

This new monster generated can be of a new type to you.

Just ignore it in this case...

Study the next case: The Flocking Kickable Monster will be pushed instead of Kicked.


Pushing is Always a Priority.


Kicking Only Works for lone Monsters...

This is the Fourth Plague monster:


The Spawner Monster!

Bump Against him and he will jump to the Position you were Previously Occupying.


Spawns a new Random Monster over Hero's new Frontal Tile.
TIP: (Spoilers) Try to Spawn two Flocking Slayers and then Push both Southwards.

This is The Grabber Plague Monster:


It Allows you to Grab and Drag another Monster Backwards.

Bump Against A Grabber to Activate the Grabbing Ability.


Moving Away from Grabbers Deactivate this Ability.

Step by Step:


1) Bump Against the Grabber to Activate Ability.

2) Frontface the Slayer Monster.

3) Move Backwards to Drag it.

Notice that you cannot move the Grabber that is Activating the Ability.

Other Grabbers Can be moved without problem.


Flocking Grabbers can be Pushed as well...

This is the Fifth Type:

The Cloner Plague Monster!


This Specimen Allows you to Choose the Next Spawned Monster Type.

(Instead of Random Type)

To Choose the next Spawned Monster type:


1) Have a Cloner Around You.

2) Rotate Towards Another neighbor Monster of the type you want to Clone.

3) Bump Against the Cloner.

4) Success: Check the "Next" Message indicating your next monster type.


As long as you keep walking around Cloners, the Cloning Ability will be maintained active.

TIP: Always have at least one Cloner Around you to Maintain this Ability Active.

The Cloner himself cannot be chosen, only another Plague Monsters Around him.

This Cube is a Tutorial About The "Glow Ability".


Notice that Nothing Happens When You get close to a solo Monster...

But When You're Neighboring Flocking Monsters, Some Kind of Glow Radiates around you...


This Glow Gives you Extra Power...
The Two Monsters to the left cannot be killed since you cant step the water tile to directly face the back monster.

But in this case, The Glow effect gives you an Extra Angle to destroy the back monster.


Just Bump the Monster facing West while Glowing to destroy both of them.

Slayer Monsters as default have only one possible target: the Slayer's back tile.


Glowing Effect Gives 2 new possible targets besides it: The Two Backside tiles.

Swapping by Default is Available for the three Back Tiles.


Any of the Three Monsters above the Swapper can be Chosen for Swapping.


Think before Proceeding or you'll have to restart.

But While Glowing, Any Swapping Direction is Available!


Check the "Side Swapping" to the right.
Backside Swapping ahead!
Move the Mouse over a Plague monster to Discover Glowing Bonuses.

Glowing Ability:


Kickable Monsters needs Two Free tiles to be Kicked to.


Kick all them towards the alcoves and study the cases...
This one cannot even be kicked since there's only one free spot...

Glowing Ability reduces the Spawned monster Amount to just One.


Much Easier to handle!

TIP: Kickable monsters can be Kicked to Any direction.


(Defined by Hero Orientation)
This is Backward Grab, Available in any Situation...
This is a Backside Grab, Also Available by Default...

But This is a SIDE Grab!


Only Available When Glow Effect is Active.
This is the Blocker Plague Monster!
It Just Blocks your Path!

Notice that When you Kill a Monster, You Gain Plague Monster Tokens.


These Tokens can be used to Destroy Blockers.


Just Bump Against Blockers to Destroy them!


(Check the amount of Tokens in Stock in the Resources Panel)
Fontface any Blocker To Check Killing Price...
A Solo Blocker Costs a Fixed amount, Depending on the quest it is located.

(Advanced Information for Experts)

The Final Cost to Kill a Blocker it is defined By:


X = Base (Solo) Value.

Y = Amount of Flocking Monsters Around the Blocker.

Z = Amount of Flocking Monsters Around the Hero.



Total Cost = X - Y - Z


1) No Flocking Monster is Accounted twice, Only Once.

2) If the Blocker itself is Flocking or not, it doesn't matter. It is always ignored.

3) Minimum Cost is Always 1.
Test the cases above and notice how you can Lower the costs in some situations.

Plague Monsters Appears Principally in the Farm.

You cannot Move Diagonally there.


Stoonepath will be used here to Simulate Farm Movement, 
Restricting your Diagonal Steps.
TIP: Diagonal Movement is still Permited over grass.

This is a Tutorial about Gaining Free Diagonal Movement steps:


As Said Before, You can't Move diagonally in the Farm or in the Stonepath...
Notice That, as you Kill a Monster, you also move to the old monster position.

Use this automatic Movement to Temporally gain a free Diagonal Movement.


(Diagonal Steps are Allowed in this case).
You 've Just gained a Diagonal move for free!
You can use this trick in the Farm, too...
It Works with the Spawner Monster in the same way...
And The Kickable Monster as well...
Pushing Flocking Monsters Also Give you that Free Diagonal Step...
And Finally. Killing A Blocker Also Traverses you Diagonally for Free!

Mouse over monsters for more information.


Challenge: Try to Beat this cube without destroying Blockers with Tokens.

Plague monsters are kinda complicated in the beginning but are Pretty cool after you learn the ropes.

Don't give up!

Another Trick: You can Align several Plague monsters of the same type for a "Line Kill".


A Line kill not only allows you to kill more than one Monster in a single shot but also gives you progressively extra bonuses.


Study the two cases to the left...

(Kill all the monsters Rotating Kade Westbound)

NEO has a Powerful Random Cube Generator!


Virtually any kind of Cube can be Randomly made using a nice set o AI tools!


From this Cube On Everything is Randomly Generated!

It means: Unlimited Gameplay!

Check the "Beasts:" text in the upper right part of the screen.


The first number Shows the amount of Killed Monsters.


The Second number Shows the total Amount of Monsters in the Cube.


"Awaken" Shows the number of monsters that are awakened. (Not resting)


"Gate" Indicates the amount of monsters you need to kill to open the next gate.

NEO is also an Idle game!


Resources are produced at the farm even if your PC is Shut Down.


Come back anytime soon to upgrade Buildings in your farm, freeing up space for Increased resource production.

Pick up the Hook on the Ground to attack the Scarabs.


The ONLY way to perform a successful Attack is as Follows:


1) Move to a Scarab Neighbor tile.

2) ROTATE the Hook until you Stick it Inside him.


Beware the hook is very Fragile!

Wrongly Moving it over a monster will destroy it.

Rotating towards the wrong way will destroy it as well.

When you attack a Higher Level Monster with the Hook, it will get Stuck!


Drag the Stuck Monster against an Obstacle to perform a Slash Attack.


Hooked Monsters cannot Attack you.
You can Jump Over Hooked Monsters!
Dragging the monster against Water tiles Won't work!
Notice that you cannot Rotate While Roaming with a Hooked Monster.
This is the fan. When it's off, it has no effect.
However, when you step in front of it, it activates.

The fan blows you in its direction, affecting your next move and even lifting you over obstacles. 

Step the mud tile and press right to test it now.

In short: Your final position combines the push from all active fans facing you and your chosen move.


Count with me:

2 fans equals two tiles to the right.

Add to that: Southeast Move.

Final Target: Other Mud tile

If your final position is a solid block, like a forest tile, you'll simply be blocked. 
But if it's water or a pit, you'll fall to your death.

Be careful! Add up the fans to your next move to see where you'll end up.

When a fan is blowing, the position from which you push becomes the position the fan pushes you into. 

In this case, the fan will push you onto the water tile to the left. 

As you move northeast from there, you'll be pushing the other fan from the water tile in the northeast direction.

In the next case, you will perform a SLIDE push from the water!

First: Sum the two fans blowing you, and check the tile.

You will be pushing the other fan in a Slide push against the wall as you press the NW key.

Step in front of the fan and press NE. 

The blue line shows the fan’s force; the red line shows the hero’s movement.

Arrows  don’t affect the fan’s force but do block the hero.

You can float past the first arrow, but the second one blocks you, as shown by the red line.

While Blue line shows the Fan's floating vector, The red line represents tiles the hero effectively moves through—it can trigger traps, activate levers, 
be blocked by arrows, push objects, and interact with elements just like normal movement.

Fans can be activated or deactivated by orbs and keys in NEO. 

Once a fan has been activated by an orb, it will remain on forever until deactivated again.
Interacting with a permanently active fan by stepping in front of it will break its permanent state.

Hit an orb to trigger a key next to a fan. 
Green keys turn fans on, red ones turn them off, and neutral keys just toggle them.

First Wasp Rule: You need to Wake up the Wasp Mother First in Order To Shoot the Baby Wasps.


Shoot them from Afar not to Die!
Second Rule: You can only kill the mother wasp after killing all the babies.

Third Rule: Wasps only attack (around them) when They move. 


(train your ear using the tic tac noise or the visual indicator as a guide)

Tic Tac Movement Tip: It Works like a 4/4 Musical Time Signature.


Strong beat means Wasps moving and Attacking.

You can Walk around Wasps Freely, but better Avoid to have a wasp arround

 you when the Strong Beat (wasp move time) comes.
TIP: The Numbers on The mother wasp Indicates: remaining wasps / max wasps
TIP: Wasps can be Pushed over Mud.

If There's a percentage number in the Mother wasp, it means they can reproduce!


Precision is the key in this case.

Kill them Quickly!
The percentage number represents the rate at which new Wasps are spawned relative to Hero's base Shooting Speed.

Examples: 


10% Means that a new wasp is spawned in a time lapse of 10 hero's Shots. 

(Slow breeding Speed: Easy Difficulty )


25% Means that a new wasp is spawned in a time lapse of 4 hero's Shots.
 
(Average breeding Speed: Average Difficulty )


50% Means that a new wasp is spawned in a time lapse of 2 hero's Shots.

(Fast breeding Speed: Hard Difficulty )

Above 90% Is Extremelly Difficult to Kill All the wasps.


100% is virtually impossible without extra Shooting speed bonuses!

Every shot counts in this case!

Fire Mark Strategy: Fire Alone does not represent a big threat against Wasps since Wasps move Randomly.


Any Hero Adjacent Wasp will be "Fire Marked" (Changed Color), Whenever Kade has a Firepit Lit by his side.

 
A Fire Marked Wasp will self Sacrifice into any Adjacent Fire tile on the next move while skipping Attack!


If there´s no Firepit in the vicinity, the marked wasp will also prefer to move to a hero neighbor tile if Available.


(Use this strategy to Guide Wasps to a desired position)

Also: Firemarked Wasps Can be Pushed anywhere and will Firemark others wasps around hero while pushed.

A Shielded Wasp Blocks all Attacks in the current Tile!


To kill a Shielded Wasp, Shoot it from an Adjacent Tile.

Very Important:


While Shooting from afar tends to be much more safe, 
You can Get Shooting Speed Bonuses by having Wasps Around you or in your Frontal Shooting row.


The more Wasp Occupied Tiles you have the better.


(Notice the Percentage indicator Around Kade Indicating Current Bonus)

Fighting against wasps is a risk x reward situation.

Try to have the Highest number of wasp occupied tiles by your side to Shoot Faster,

but move away from them in time before they attack.

Strategy: New babies are only spawned in tiles already occupied by wasps. 


You cannot tell them where to go, but you can tell them where NOT to go. 

 
(keep killing by the borders, this way you can take "Sweep" them all to a desired position like a firepit or dead end for example)
Whenever you Shoot a Wasp over a water Tile, you Get a Bonus for a few Seconds.

TIP: Wasps avoid pits at all costs, since it´s very risky for them to fly over them due to the strong Winds.


(You can take advantage of if by walling them off)
Platform Attack Speed Bonus Tutorial Entrance Here!

You receive increased attack speed bonuses for every consecutive platform you step on...


Important: Step on the Platform and Check The Attack Speed Bonus Indicated by the hero percentage number.
The farther you go, the better the bonuses get... (Faster Shooting!)

Almost Twice the Original Attack Speed!!!


Congratulations Kade! You're now practically an Arrow Machinegun!!!

Notice That you lose the Bonus as soon as you step over grass.


(Bonus Effect is only Valid While Shooting from Platforms or mud contiguously)

As A Final Word, Use These Platforms to Study about This Rule.


Notice That:


1)-Bonuses Are Kept When Switching From the Dark Platform to the Light one or mud.

2)-Bonus Is Reset When Kade Reenters a new Dark Platform Group.

3)-Only Dark Platform can provide Speed Bonus.
Notice how Gray Platforms or Mud terrain can be used to Extend Attack Speed Bonus.
Pickup the Quiver to increase Shooting Speed.

TIP: Kill Enraged (Circled) wasps as Quickly as you can!

They make their mother get Progressively stronger overtime.
TIP: Boomerang kills all the wasps in the tile.

My Diary: I need to be quick since these flying creatures are behaving quite agressivelly. 

 
As a matter of fact, I've seen some eggs scattered in the area, They must be protecting their offspring...


BackShooting them may be a better option for Maximized damage.


A single hit may be fatal in these conditions.

My Diary: It seems that there is a hunt going on here...



The problem is that I'm suspecting that...



...I'M THE PREY...

NEO is most of the time a randomly generated Game. which means: 

There's always something new if you want to replay a level.

The Game start in realtime mode, and slowly blends into a stepping game as new maps are unlocked. 


Be ready to confront both realtime and stepping monsters all together in the same fight!


(Stepping = Turn Based Game)

Press Special Z Key to speed up time. 

Monsters will move faster this way.

Pick up the Spear on the Ground.

Use it to throw at your enemies!

Spear Throwing:


First Rule: Spears are Only Thrown IMMEDIATELY after Kade Moves.

Second Rule: Throwing Direction is the same as the Movement Made.

Third Rule: Throw only when the Spear is aligned with the target.

The Spear sits around the hero like the Shield.
Note that Spears can only be thrown from side tiles, not from the front or back.
It has: Unlimited range. Devastating attack!
Spears Can Reach Places other Weapons Can't!
You can only throw the spear from open, obstacle-free terrain.
Behold! The axe that strikes where no blade dares!

Throwing Axe Targets:

Place the Throwing Axe on the center mud tile.

It will hit the 8 mud tiles around it in a chess knight’s move pattern, two tiles in one direction and one in the other.

(Counting from the weapon tile).
The Throwing Axe can strike monsters through walls, ignoring any obstacle in its path.
It can even strike multiple monsters at once, hitting them all in a single devastating blow.

The Throwing Axe only attacks after you move.

Plan carefull! Wake up the scarabs wisely to defeat them all in a single blow.

There are different ways to equip weapons in NEO.
1) Orbit Slot: This slot is called Orbit because captured objects rotate together with the hero as they turn.

Notice the differences between these two axes.
The one on the right has two arrows beneath it.

A weapon with two arrows beneath it is placed in the Called:

"Anchor Slot", positioned two or three tiles away from the hero.

1) Orbit Slot: (1 Arrow Beneath)
Placed close to the hero (in neighboring tiles).
Weapons rotate together with the hero when they turn.

Anchor Slot: (2 Arrows Beneath)
Placed farther from the hero (2 or 3 tiles away).
Weapons remain static and do not rotate with the hero.
Rotate and see the difference.

This is a step-by-step tutorial on how to position a weapon precisely where you want using the Anchor Slot.

Start by facing North...

1) The weapon is automatically placed 2 tiles ahead in the direction of the hero’s next movement.
2) The hero’s current facing direction is added as a vector to that.

The mud tile indicates the final destination:
two tiles in the movement direction, 
plus one tile in the hero’s facing direction (North in this example).

Now face Southeast. Count two tiles in the movement direction (East) as you step along , then add the hero’s facing direction.

The mud tile indicates the weapon’s final position after you move.
Turn to face West. Measure two tiles in the movement direction, then apply the hero’s facing direction.
Important: fixed weapons cannot be placed next to the hero. They stay two tiles away if Hero points it to a neighbor tile.

1) - Face West and pick up the axe.

2) - The calculated position would be adjacent! (Forbidden for fixed weapons)

3) - Notice the error message.

4) - Result: the extra tile is canceled and the axe is placed two tiles away (Default target).

Face Southwest and pick up the axe. 
The calculated position would normally include the extra tile in the hero’s facing direction, but the sum is adjacent. 
The extra tile is canceled again, and the axe is placed two tiles away (default target).

Finally, try to kill all the scarabs by positioning the axe correctly.
Remember: the axe must be thrown FROM a CLEAR TILE, not a tall one like a forest.
When a spear is thrown, each target it passes over increases the number of spears thrown by +1.

Calculate weapon placement wisely.
With only one spear, you'll need to double your attack against those two scarabs.
The symbol in the gate below means the amount of monsters you need to kill in order to open it.

My diary: 
My reflection in the pond is a stranger wearing my memories. How long until I forget I ever was Kade?

My Diary: I just Foud Some kind of ancient Mask here!

Looks Interesting!


I'll Try to Use it to scare these Creatures...
My Diary: Interesting, They seem to be Hypnotized by this Ancient Artifact...

My Diary: These Monsters are indeed stronger than me.

But Thankfully I can take advantage of something that can turn the odds in my favor...


..That's the Brain x Brute Force! The Eternal Fight!!!

My Diary: Look at these Mushrooms!


They´re probably Poisoning as far as I know from my Biology Classes.


(Kade Step over a Mushroom can cause damage to himself, or even insta-death from the big ones).

My Diary: I just found that Mushrooms are not bad at all and can even be useful!


I've Noticed that, when a Scarab steps over one, 
it tends to keep confusedly walking in a straight line until an obstacle is found.


I'll Try to take advantage of them luring the scarabs over the fire.

My Diary:
I'm an actor. The forest is now my stage. Hunger is the best critic, and right now… he’s not impressed.
TIP: Monsters Infected By Mushrooms are affected By Arrows.
This is the Fungus Trail. It affects any monsters that step on it.
Rule 1: When a monster steps on the Fungus Trail, it becomes immobilized until you make your next move.

As you move, the monster over the Fungus will mimic your movement pattern.

Try moving north and south, back and forth, to test it.
If its movement is blocked, the monster will attempt to slide toward the Fungus Trail.

The rule to remember is simple: once a monster is on a Fungus Trail, it can only move in the following ways:
1) -Along the same direction as the trail.
2) -Perpendicular to the trail.
Diagonal movement is not possible.
If attempted, the monster will slide against the trail’s direction.
Test diagonal move now.
Notice how perpendicular movement is free.

TIP: Pay Attention to How Mushrooms and Masks Work together.
Notice how a Diagonally Infected Scarab can "Slide" against the wall.

My Diary: 
Thought I heard voices. Just wind. Or maybe… the forest has a sense of humor.
This is the Regular Scarab, as you see you can step around him and pass through without problems.

But this is the Infected Scarab! 

Much more dangerous.


His Attack is always ready!


Notice that you cannot step the infectious green Slime around him or you're dead.

TIP: After The Scarab Hits a Barricade, notice that you can step around him for a Short time.


Use this strategy to pass through him while he recovers himself from the Impact.


(Attack Readiness is indicated by the Green Slime)

Look at the shadow on the ground.

Once you step over it, You'll Rotate to face it's Direction...
Notice that once Stepping a Shadow Tile, You cannot Rotate to another Direction as well.

Shield Building Tutorial: (Important)


1) - Step over a shield containing a shadow.

2) - Now, Rotation is Locked towards shadow orientation.

3) - Next step, (Stepping outwards shield tile) defines shield position around hero.


Learn to Build an effective shield for maximized protection.

As a challenge, Practice building a Big shield all around the hero below.
 (full Circular protection around the body)

My Diary: I just noticed that when I step on mud, infected monsters don’t attack me. 
It must be because my entire body is covered in mud. 
These creatures might have some kind of thermal vision... 
I also realized that they don’t attack me when they’re standing on mud themselves. 
Maybe the mud affects their sight somehow.

You can hide yourself behind obstacles from the Attacks of wide radius Infected Scarab.


Line of Sight is required for his attack to be triggered.

Notice How the Forest tile and the arrow is protecting you from being attacked right now.


The scarab has lost the Line of Sight to you down here...

The firepit to the south provides unlimited Fire Hits.
(No logs appear after it's lit.)

The firepit to the south provides a limited number of Fire Hits.
(Available Fire Hits are indicated by the logs.)

TIPS on fighting this monster:

1) High attack, be careful!

2) Pay attention to the crow caw sound. It shows he is ready to attack.

3) When he starts fast flying toward you, just step aside a few moments before he comes too close.

There's no need to hurry! This is called the "El Torero" maneuver.
Running away like crazy is tantamount to a death sentence!
Calm is the best strategy against this monster.

Practice it now!

My Diary:

One of these days, I was observing a giant bat while it was eating.

They allow you to come a little closer while they are feeding.

They are horrendous! A mixture of a human face with a devilish look!

I think I’m going to call them “Devils.”

Pay attention to the crow’s caw.
It signals that the Devil is ready to attack.

Oxygen lets you catch your breath
(and Plan you Strategy)
while running in the wilderness!


1) -Pick up Oxygen Tokens.

2) -Press Space Key for a little extra air.

3) -Moving in any direction will cancel it.
TIP: Practice the El Torero Maneuver against the Devil Monster (explained in the 2nd Cube) or you won’t get far in this quest.

My Diary: The Fight for Survival Can Change You

As an artist, I once had a peculiar personality,
driven by intellect and creativity.
But after all this fighting, I feel different.
There is no room left for secondary thoughts,
nothing that distracts me from the need to stay alive.

My nature has changed. I feel constantly grounded.
The impulsive creativity I once had is gone.
It feels as if my mind has spread through my whole body,
into my arms and muscles,
no longer confined to my head.

This is the brain:
It teaches monsters how to hunt you.
They move with purpose now,
reacting, learning, adapting.
No one knows what it remembers,
only that it makes them smarter… and deadlier.

This is the QQ!
First rule: never get in front of him.

My Diary:
Flames dance around me, licking the stone,
Lava whispers secrets in a molten tone.
Each step a gamble, each breath a trial,
In this fiery realm, fire is my best friend in exile.

Killing a QQ requires a technique called "precision shooting." 
This ability only activates after you move, so timing your step is essential.

Precision Shooting Technique:
1) Wake up the QQ.  
2) Step onto the mud tile facing north.  
3) When the QQ passes over the upper mud tile, move north exactly as he is centered on it.

Precision is the key.
Notice that if you stand still, no shot will be fired.
Watch the centimeters message, it shows how precise your shot was.

In short: Track the QQ closely and fire your move-shot the instant he’s perfectly centered on the target tile.
WARNING: You must land three shots before he reaches the dead end now.

My Diary:
It seems these monsters are evolving.
They’re trying to fight and kill me...
as if I were a virus in their world...
as if their world were a body...
...and I were the infection.

Notice the difference between the two QQs. The one on the right has a life Count, and the one on the left has hit points.
Precision becomes even more important when fighting HP-type QQs.
Each centimeter counts. A shot closer to the center drains more of the target’s hit points.
TIP: An eye shot can further increase your damage by 20%.

Fishing Tutorial:
1) Step the fishing pole to throw the hook.
2) Use the movement keys to control it. 
3) Try to raise the percentage as high as possible.
4) When time runs out, the percentage will show your chance of catching the fish.
Use the matching fish type to open the gate.
My Diary: I'm Starving! I need to Find a Way to Cook these Fish...

Be careful not to move the hook over the grass or you may lose it!


Walkable tiles like grass or rafts can destroy your hook!

 Forest Tiles Only Block Movement.

Important: Try to aim precisely! The finer your aim, the higher your fishing chance rises.

When the fishing hook is positioned close to the center of the fish, it turns solid green, 
granting a 2x speed bonus to your Fishing Attack rate.

Pay attention to this!

Tip: Check the percentage indicator on the fish:

If it’s green, it increases twice as fast as the yellow (normal) level.
If it’s red, its increase rate can drop to four times slower than normal.

TIP: Always go for the green ones!

Watch out for the algae in the water!
Fish can swim below it, but your hook may get stuck (blocked)!

Manta rays move in a different fashion...
Try to study it!

Advanced Strategy for Expert Players (optional reading):

There's something special about the WATER SNAKE:

Catch 1 Snake and get a Rarity 1 Fish added to your inventory.
Catch 2 in the same Hook Pull and gain a Rarity 2 Fish.
Catch 3 in the same Hook Pull and gain a Rarity 3 Fish.
And so on...

Rare Fish are Bonus Global Resources that remain in the inventory after the game is over.

They can be used in the farm and to buy upgrades later on, and cannot be used here in the cubes.

(Global Bonuses DO NOT AFFECT GAMEPLAY)

TIP: Use the orb to traverse large distances (bump against it).
Notice how arrows affect travelling direction.

Learn how to use the harpoon gun:

While fast travelling, notice the sharp-pointing harpoon gun indicator.
Use it to maximize fishing progress through a direct attack against the fish.

TIP: Bump against flowers in the water to gain Flower units to open the gate.
Flowers are given after a flower completely disappears by shrinking.
Bump several times to speed up the shrinking process.
The more flowers you collect, the higher your Fishing Attack Rate gets!
(Big bonuses at the end of the run)

Advanced Strategy (Optional reading for starters)
Water Flower Tutorial:

1) When the hook touches a water flower, it turns red, starts rotating, and shrinking.
2) After a few seconds, it returns to yellow and can be touched again.
3) Rotation speed indicates shrinking rate — the faster, the better.
4) Each subsequent touch increases rotation (and shrinking) speed.
5) When the flower completely disappears, you gain a flower unit (check Resources panel).
6) Each flower unit gives cumulative bonuses:

+15% to shrinking/rotation speed

+7% to hook attack rate (fishing rate increases faster over fish)
Bonus amounts are shown in the lower left of the screen.
Seventh) The more simultaneous red flowers you have, the faster all red flowers rotate (~20% extra per flower).
TIP: The small bush with a red arrow in the water blocks the hook, following the same rules as the arrows on land.
The Jump tile can provide quite a lot of Agility to your Fishing...
Notice How Jump Tiles Conserves Hook Momentum While Fast Travelling.

Pickup Pole Tokens to Reuse Fishing Poles that have already been used.


You can Reactivate it by stepping over a previously used pole tile.

Hook Bonus Tutorial:


Some Hooks can Provide special Bonuses if Certain Conditions are met.


Bonuses are indicated by a text message located below the Hook.
This Hook will give you a Water Flower to open the gate as soon as you Attack the fish for the first time.

Important: As a general rule, the first text line Indicates the CONDITION you need to Comply to earn

the Bonus indicated by the Last text Line.

In this case the Bonus is 5 extra seconds for Fishing Time.

Condition: Attack an Untouched Fish.


(Untouched means: not yet attacked, a fish at 0%)

Condition (First line): Strike the orb 8 Times.

Bonus (Second Line): Gain Water Flower Prize
Notice that text color Changes to Green as you Succeed.

In this impossible case, you need to Attack a fish for the first time when it's Percentage is Above 20%


You will Deliberately Fail.


(Notice the Text Color changing to RED as you Fail).

By Failing, No spawning will be done, and the Bonus will become Disabled Throughout the whole session.
Always Plan Ahead the Pole Usage Order!

Collect Harpoon Tokens to use the Harpoon as much as you want!


Press Any Rotation Key (C or V) + Movement Key to Throw Harpoon towards that Direction.


Note that you can change Harpoon direction on the run,

Try not to lose your Hook in the grass tiles below.

The reason for this cube is to serve as a Sandbox for you to test several Pole Bonuses.


All you have to do to is to choose 10 Poles and conquer them, so you can use 
the pole to the right to destroy the rafts and strike the orb.


You can return anytime to test new ideas.


Try to get as much fish as you can!

Post your Record in the Forums!

Did you Know?


NEO can form More than a Thousand Different Pole Combinations!


Use this cube to train, learn, improve strategies and never lose a Pole Bonus while fishing!

Important: While in Harpoon Mode over a Fast Tile, you can Change the Harpoon Direction by Bumping against a Forest Tile.


Cast the Harpoon to the North and press N, NE and NW move keys against the Forest tiles near the mud tile to test it.

Neighbor Orbs will rebound a Passing by Harpoon if move Keys are Pressed on the fly.


Test it now. Try not to destroy the hook!
Not only Forest Tiles, but any tile that Blocks the hook will invert the Harpoon Direction while over Fast Tiles, even Arrows.

Hook Merging Tutorial:


1) Enable Merging using the pole near the Boulders.

2) Get a Secondary Hook in the lower Pool

3) Move 2 hooks close to each other to Merge them.

Merged Hooks will give you an Extra Fishing Level, Improving your Fishing Ability.

Note that Secondary Hooks Have their Attack Reduced by Half.


The Main Hook is White Colored, Different than the others.

You can Only Upgrade your Fishing Level by merging with the Main hook.


Secondary Hooks merged will give Extra levels when merging to the Main Hook.
"My diary: The noises these monsters do at night could frighten even the bravest Hollywood hero!
PS: Not Including Chuck Norris, off course...

My Diary:
As an actor, I once died dramatically on stage. Here, if I die, there won’t be applause. Just silence.
TIP: The Spiked Ball can be used to Pull the Lever.

This is the Hugger!


Notice that he Grabs you as you step around him...

Count the Amount of Arms he uses  to Hug you:


1 Step Around him -> 1 Arm.

2 Steps Around -> 2 Arms.

Huggers cannot be attacked by regular Weapons.


The only way to Attack him is to

STEP AWAY from him while he's hugging you with "BOTH HIS ARMS"!

Important! Count the steps now:


1) First step around - First arm touches you.


2) Second step Around - Second Arm touches you.


3) Third Step AWAY from him - You Attack him!


(Attack is Automatic)

Also important, What You SHOULD NOT do:


1) Performing a THIRD STEP Around him. (while being grabbed by both of his arms).


2) Stepping AWAY having just ONE ARM Grabbing You.


3) Stepping Away from him towards the tile you 've entered his vicinity.


This tile is indicated by a green substance (his poo ;-))

All these actions result in an insta-death.
Think before Waking him up...

Now notice the Green substance indicating the vicinity entrance tile.

(Insta-Death Step)

Think twice now or you may die!

(Stepping away with just one arm grabbing you means death)

Notice the Graphical Difference between these 2 Huggers:


The uppermost is a normal one.

But the one to the south has a baby on his back.


Meaning: it needs TWO hits to be killed.

Caution: Next Hugger is a Level 2 one!

2 hits are required to kill him!

(Notice the Baby in his Back)

Higher Level Huggers make a Move immediately after Kade Steps AWAY from him. 

(After you Attack him).


Strategy is required to defeat them.

Lava is dense and scorching, a sea of fire that resists every step.

To move rafts across it is to wrestle against nature’s fury, demanding tremendous effort.
Rule One: Step onto a lava tile, and the raft instantly shifts in the direction you move.
Rule Two: While on a raft, moving onto another lava tile with a raft will also shift that raft, as long as movement is possible.

Rule Three: Rafts slide along walls when you attempt a diagonal move.

In the next example, if you try to move northwest and that direction is blocked, the raft will slide and move west instead.


Also: If both orthogonal moves are possible, raft slide is blocked.

Strong arms are a luxury in the wilderness.
You’ll need every ounce of strength to push rafts, climb obstacles, and survive the night.


Rule: Kade can use his arms to push rafts across the lava by Bumping against tall obstacles, such as forest tiles
Rule Exception: If you move from or onto a broken raft, the entire raft group will not move.

My Diary:
What a weird Creature! At first, I thought he wanted to give me a Hug because he liked me!
Just got a Black Eye!
My Diary: Tell Mother Nature I want EMANCIPATION from her for such a Bizarre Creation!

My Diary:
Silence makes you think too much. I’d kill for a wrong phone call.

Jump onto the raft facing west.
Notice the Hands Icon: It means you've latched onto the wall.
Use the rotation keys to pivot the raft.
To grab a wall, you must move toward it. Simply rotating won’t work.

Hugers Can be Pushed over Mud!


Notice that No Arm Hugging is Triggered while Pushing Occurs Allowing you to withstand more Steps Around Him.

My Diary: These Blue Creeps are so strange! 


Whatever direction I Look at they tend to look too!


(Use Rotation Ability to Guide These Blue Flying Creature´s Flight Route.

You can also Use them to pick up resources for you).

This is the Fog! 


Every Bunch of adjacently connected Fog Tiles is Called a Fog Cloud. 


Notice that each Fog Group (or cloud) changes the color as you step inside them.
You are free to enter or leave a (white) FOG Group as you wish.

This is a Group!


Notice the Color Changing as you step inside it.

Another group!


Diagonally connected tiles also count...
Another one!

And Another one!


The color changing helps you to distinct one group from another.
This Fog Group is RED! It means that there's a monster inside it!

Notice that you cannot Attack or even wake up a monster that is inside a Red (Dirty) fog Cloud.


You need to be inside ANY fog Group to do so...

As soon as you enter a RED (Dirty) fog Group, you can only 
leave it by killing or Driving EVERY monster out of it.


Notice that you cannot leave this Group Since it contains a monster.

Important: Only the hero is affected by Fog.


Monsters Movement is not restricted by them.


TIP: Take the Scarab to the Fogless Tile So you can Leave the Cloud.


TIP 2: Be Quick! It's all about timing.

Spoilers Ahead!


Try to kill the Scarab without reading the scroll to the East.

Spoilers:

 
1) -You need to enter the red Fog to Wake up the monster.


2) - Now you're stuck inside the cloud.


3) -Take the Monster to the Fogless tile.


4) - Now you're free to do the Killing!

When a Fog Group is touching An orb, its becomes electrified!


As you step Inside an Electrified (blue) Fog Group, it starts moving until it touches another orb or fog group.


(Moving orientation works the same way as the Raft depending on entrance direction)


Be Careful! You remain stuck inside a moving cloud until it Doesn't stop Moving.
TIP: Cloud Stops moving as soon as it Touches another cloud or Orb.

You can only Leave or Enter a moving cloud jumping out or from another cloud.


Try not to die here! 


Quickly jump to the white (stopped) cloud in the left side as soon as you reach the Northern area.

My diary:


There's one thing the fleas in my shelter and I thoroughly agree:

We both would love to have a dog here!

Rule: Monsters inside Clouds can Only be killed from Inside (ANY) Cloud.


TIP: You can Only enter the moving cloud from another cloud.
Bring the Big cloud to the mud tile so you can kill this clouded Scarab.
Be Careful not to catch a Water Frog! You may lose all your fish!

Advanced TIP: (Optional reading if you're a beginner)


You can increase the Fishing speed Bonus by:


1) -Keeping the hook over a fish for the longest time possible.


2) -Switching from one fish to another without losing them. 


IMPORTANT: Do not lose fish contact or everything needs to be restarted over again. 


Keep the hook over a fish for at least 2 seconds, and them 
switch to another passing by fish that is close to the hook.


Massive bonus can be achieved! 
The more switches you can make, the better! 

It's Cummulative!

These are Butchers.
They have a Pole that Keeps Rotating.
Like most of other Objects, they can be pushed over mud.
Some Objects can be Hanged in the pole like an Axe for example.

Use the axes to kill monsters.
TIP:Axes wont hurt you.

TIP: The Axe can ONLY Damage Monsters.

The Spiked Ball can ONLY Damage Kade.

Bamboo Stick! The Forest Fighter's Ally


Light but sturdy, the Bamboo Stick is more than it seems. 

Its first and most important rule: it pushes Enemies!
 
Use it to shove enemies away, create breathing room in tight encounters, or knock foes into traps and hazards.

A simple tool, but a powerful extension of your survival instincts.

Remember: you can’t hurt them directly.

To defeat an enemy, you must push them into a solid obstacle, like a forest tile, orb, or wall, etc.

Plan your moves carefully - positioning is key.

Push enemies to control space!

To kill, slam them sideways or by rotation into solid tiles.

Warning: Frontal pushes, or pushing into water, and pits won't work.

It'll just block your path.

The Butcher can grant you special bonuses!

Watch the arrow rotating around it closely.

When you move near the green altar bonus, a fixed arrow will appear.
 
Your goal is to match the rotating arrow with the fixed one.

Bump into the Butcher at the right moment to align the arrows and earn the Fish reward!

Notice the text showing your chances to win: 

They range from 0% to 50%. 

The closer you align the rotating arrow with the fixed one, the higher your chances of winning a prize.

There are also two small arrows marking the limit of the bonus zone.
 
If you hit the altar outside that range, your chances drop to 0%, so time it carefully!

The green indicator (Arrow) shows the prize you earn for a successful bump.

The red indicator (Crab) shows the cost of each bump.

Now try to collect enough arrows to take down all the scarabs!

Try not to run out of crabs for that...

When you bump into a Butcher containing a pole icon, 

the prize shown beside that pole icon will appear hanging on a random nearby pole.

Be quick! The prize only remains for a few seconds before it disappears.

Butcher’s Blades:

If a blade is present near the Butcher, beware: each missed bump triggers danger.

A new blade will spawn at a random nearby pole whenever you fail an Attempt.

Also: Bump into the altar from the blade icon and succeed to remove a random blade.

The arena becomes more hostile with every mistake.

When you push a monster, either using the bamboo stick or by sliding it over mud, its movement timer resets.

This gives you a brief window to reposition or act safely before the monster moves again.

You can push fire pits over mud tiles...
...but only if they're not burning!

Logs burn and vanish when pushed over burning firepits. 
Test it above...
Logs can block your path, choose your steps wisely.

Important: Every Butcher usually has a cost shown by a price tag.

If that is missing, the default price will be one Butcher Coin.

Example: The Butcher above has no Price tag so the cost becomes 1 coin.

Same happens for the Prize when absent.

Take note of the chances you get when you Bump this Butcher. 

They range from 0% to 50% depending on your accuracy.

You can now see a horseshoe! By default, the horseshoe affects all bonuses around the Butcher except for itself. 

Step on the fish tiles and check its range: 
It increases your overall chances by 10%.

Some bonuses apply in a specific direction. 

Notice the small arrow pointing downward: It indicates that only the fish tile in that direction will benefit from the bonus.

Scope: Y-shape: Only the two fish in the arrow directions receive the bonus.

Tip: their positions are marked by mud tiles.

T-shaped scope: Only the fish pointed by the arrows receive the bonus. 
Mud tiles mark them.
Scope: Neighbors. Bonus applies to adjacent fish only.

Notice the blinking horseshoe:

A blinking bonus affects ALL other bonuses globally. 

It’s the juiciest Scope Type!

This is the Lock: It disables all bonuses within its scope. 

In this case, it’s disabling the horseshoe indicated by the arrow.

Destroy the lock to get the Bonus!

This bonus doubles the effective bump angle.

Step on both mud tiles and compare the angles.

The left one will be wider and easier to hit.

This one modifies the rotation speed by the indicated value.

Remember: passive bonuses affect all bonuses within their scope which is by default, the Butcher.

Also: They do not affect themselves.


Step the mud and see the pole slowed down.

The Antenna lets you send items to other butchers across the map. Here's how it works:


1) - Bump the antenna while facing the item you want to send.
It will move to the butcher's center getting ready for transfer.


2) - To send the Centered item, bump into the Butcher from any direction.

The key is that your hero's facing direction determines the target...


3) - The item will be sent to the butcher that your hero is currently facing, as long as there's a butcher in that direction.

Step by Step:


1) - Face East and Bump the Antenna.

This selects the fish item, which is located east of the butcher, and moves it to the center.


2) - Move to the Mud Tile and Face West.

Bump the Butcher. This targets the altar to the west  (Hero Front), and the fish is sent there.

Now that the fish has arrived, bump into the butcher holding the fish in its center. 

The fish will be sent to the tile directly opposite your position.


Now you've earned two fish as a reward for your successful Attempts!

The Bonus above is the Power Booster: 

On success, every bonus within its range will have its base power permanently 
multiplied by the indicated percentage.

Important:

If there's an object (such as the red fish) near a passive bonus (Booster), 
it means that this bonus has a custom price instead of the default one.

Bump into the Bank:

On success, every item in your inventory within the bank’s scope will be multiplied by the indicated percentage.

It’s compound interest in action! An investment lesson in disguise! ;-)

These are Barricades!
 They Can Block your Path...
Their Size May Vary...
They Can be Pushed Over Mud!

They Can Also Block Monsters.
Study how it Works Below...

Plan your Strategy Wisely!

You can use Barricades to Delay Monsters and Protect Yourself.
This Artifact Allows you to destroy a Level 1 Barricade!
Picking up a Second Artifact, Enables you to Destroy Level 2 Barracades and so on!

VERY IMPORTANT:  Check the D1 Number indicated in the perk in the panel Below. 


A D1 means the hero can destroy a Level 1 Barricade.


A D2 Means that a Level 2 barricade can be destroyed.

 (and so on)
TIP: Bump against a big barricade to check how many remaining "D#" power you need to destroy it.

In General, Artifacts are only valid inside their own cubes. 

Now, try to kill that monster picking up the artifacts over again.
Pick up the Artifact: It'll will give you A D1 Power to destruct Level 1 barricades.

Pick up the Second Artifact: It'll will give you A D2 Power to destruct Level 2 barricades as well. 


IMPORTANT: Notice that when you destroy a barricade, the remaining log becomes darker.


This Darker Barricade is Called:

 "Touched Barricade".
IMPORTANT: Each "Touched Barricade" Increases Destruction power to neighbor Barricades by +1.

Step by Step: 


1) - Bump against the Level 2 barricade Just once. 


2) - This will become a touched Barricade (darker).


3) - Now it is "Borrowing" +1 Destruction power to the Adjacent Level 3 Barricade.


4) - Try to destroy the neighbor Level 3 Barricade with your D2 Power plus the +1 from the neighbor touched barricade.


(Be careful not to destroy the small barricade entirely).

D3 power now!


Hint: Rotate Kade facing a barricade to Check his Destruction power towards it. 


for example: a "D3 + 2" showed in the perk's icon means that the hero has a destruction power of D3 
plus two adjacent Touched Barricades that equals to D5.

The Objective of this Quest is to Provide a challenge for both Newbies and pros.


If you´re just starting, just Go for the Bronze and proceed to the next quest.

 
If you think you´re good, try the other trophies too.


You can come back later when you get more experienced since getting the silver or gold is kinda HARDER.

Warning: Do not Wake up the Devil Monsters (Flying ones).


Its an Optional Challenge just for the Pros Trying the Genius Trophy.

Hint: Sometimes it´s a better idea to start from the most difficult cube first and then descend the difficulty order
 if you´re going for the hard Trophies. 

(To avoid repetition)

This is the boomerang!
One of your best friends when it comes to surviving these harsh lands...

First rule: Step on the icon facing the direction you want to throw it.
(North, in this case)
Press the Wait key (X by default) to advance the turn.

Second rule: Boomerangs will keep flying forever until you move toward the opposite direction they were thrown.

Example: If you throw one to the east, any westward movement will make it come back...

Third rule: You can control the boomerang's target with the hero's position.

Experiment here with these boomerangs until you feel comfortable.

Every boomerang hit costs 1 boomerang unit.

Collect more boomerang units to kill more than one monster in a single shot.

Be careful not to destroy your boomerang!

Try to avoid walls...
Tip: Move southbound at the right time to call the boomerang back and kill the scarab.

Diagonal throwing is not allowed.
You need to step on the boomerang's icon facing either north, south, east, or west.

The boomerang is automatically rethrown toward the hero's direction when it returns to him.

Exception: It cannot be rethrown in the same direction it came from (when the hero is backfacing it).

My Diary: It seems that as soon as I step onto a stopped raft,
I can use my own body weight to push it in the direction I want...

TIP: As you enter a static raft, it starts moving toward the direction you entered it.

It keeps moving back and forth until you drop out of it.

Dynamic rafts like these aren't affected by hero movement.

They keep moving forever...

Only static rafts are affected by hero impulsion force.

My Diary:

Just a reminder:
The first thing to do back home
is to throw away my coconut shampoo.

You can use rudders to change your raft's direction. Rules:

1) You must have at least 1 rudder unit in your inventory.
2) While sailing, bump against the raft border to change its direction.
3) The bump direction defines the new sailing direction.
4) You can only change the raft’s course by a maximum of 45 degrees.
Example: If you are sailing south, the course can only change to southeast or southwest.
5) Only one course change is allowed until the raft rebounds or a new rudder is picked up.
Press F9 to toggle the underwater grid.

You can use the raft to pick up resources in the water following ONE rule:

Kade needs to be located on the raft tile where the resource is located.

(Otherwise, the resource is destroyed)

TIP: You can change the raft's sailing direction again after picking up a new rudder.

Use this technique to make sharp turns.

(No need to wait for raft rebound)

TIP: If the raft hammer is pushed from a raft tile, that specific raft is expanded.

If it is pushed from a land tile, a new independent raft is created.
Use these ponds as a sandbox to study how raft hammers work.

Step onto a broken section of your raft. If the raft splits into two parts, it will change direction to match the way you just moved.

Use this technique to steer around obstacles and control your course more precisely.
Kade: -Feeling Dizzy...

These are Frogs!


Their bite can be quite poisonous and hallucinogenic.
Important: Frogs attack all adjacent tiles immediately after landing.
Frogs can Jump over Obstacles!

Frogs move like the Knight from chess.


(check the 8 possible moves around him indicated by the mud tiles)

Frogs are agile—but they have a major weakness:


The Frog Block!


If you quickly move into one of their 8 possible jump targets, you’ll block the jump and deal damage.


Step onto a mud tile and hold your ground.

Notice: Kade will block the frog and also throw small rocks to attack it.


(No extra ammo required.)

My Diary:

It seems that when I stare directly at a frog, facing him head-on, he just stares back without moving.

Feels like I’m hypnotizing him! Heh.

(TIP: Face a frog directly to delay its movement.)

Tip: You can delay a frog’s movement in two ways:

1) -Occupy one of its 8 jump targets to prevent it from leaping.

2) -Front-face the frog—just rotate and stare it down to freeze it in place.

Notice the frog's color: When it turns red, it’s about to jump.

Now, try quickly running to the mud tile while facing the frog directly.

Watch how its color changes!

By doing this, you can delay the frog's movement.

Move south and north to see the color shift back and forth.

You’re in control! decide when the frog jumps!

Strategy:

1) -Frogs prefer to jump toward tiles that are directly faced by the hero.

2) -Step onto the Raft Tile while facing either West or East.

3) -Watch how the frog chooses the tile you’re facing as its preferred jump target,

even if there are two valid options.

Now, test this idea by facing both directions and observe how the frog reacts!

Even Better:

Since frogs attack immediately after landing, you can completely block their attack by facing them directly as they finish landing.

This strategy is crucial to master when dealing with multiple frog encounters.

Step onto the Raft Tile facing North.

Notice how two frogs can be easily neutralized with this strategy without much effort.

The frog above will be attacked, while the lower one will be blocked.

Frog fights can be quite tactical.


Plan your moves before facing them!

Watch out! These frogs strike with lethal force.

One slip could cost you everything.
Running on the sharp stone path hurts your feet, slowing you down.

Like Days and Nights, Fire and Water, the sun and the Moon, Every monster in NEO has two Different Versions.
Realtime and Stepping Version...

The next stages introduce a stepping mechanic for the frog. It’s still experimental.
 
Watch for the stepping message when you enter the cube.

Experimental idea: Facing a frog head-on delays its movement by the number of turns shown on it. 

While doing so, you're also immune to nearby stepping monsters.

Playtesters: Feedback on the Stepping implementation for frogs and other monsters is appreciated.

Head to the forums to join the conversation.
TIP: Platform Attack Bonuses Also Affects Frogs too.

Frogs Can Swim too!


While Swimming, Frogs Move Normally, Like Scarabs.


This Can be Quite useful for Movement Pattern Prediction.
Also, While Swimming, They Still can be Blocked, but they Cannot Attack The Hero or Be Attacked.

Sliding is Performed in a Straight Line!


Be careful not to get Stuck Here otherwise you'll have to Restart.

You can collect Snow Step tokens, which allow you to alter your sliding route.

(Use the directional keys while sliding to change your trajectory.)

Check the number of Snow Steps you have in the lower-left corner of the screen.

The more torches you gather and fire pits you ignite, the stronger every source of light becomes.
 
Each flame pushes back the encroaching darkness, expanding the safety of your surroundings.
 
Light isn't just illumination...
                                                                            ...it's survival.
Install torches into empty slots to improve illumination.

The snow is relentless, and the logs are damp from the cold. 

Lighting a fire won't be easy!

You'll need six logs around the fire pit in this Quest, instead of the usual four.

Count carefully and gather what you need to spark the flames.

Torches can be used to light the fire!

Move a torch over a fire pit to reduce the number of logs needed by one.

Count 5 Logs in the next firepit and move the torch over it.
Light Firepits to earn Fire pit Points so you can open this gate.

Important! Try placing the torch in a different slot above.

Key rule: The number of logs needed to light a fire pit is reduced by the total number of torches around the hero.

For example: 
The fire pit above allows only 4 logs, but you have 2 torches around you. Together, they count as 6.
The fire is on!

Keep placing torches in different slots.

This will reduce the logs needed, allowing you to light all the remaining fire pits.

Precision Sliding Technique:

As you enter snow, press the opposite direction 4 times to cancel the fast slide.
Then, use single directional taps to glide precisely, especially near cliffs.
Make clean stops when needed.
Avoid chaotic keypresses. They lead to panic... and death.

This is the Roach!


First Roach Rule: Once Attacked, the Roach Drops a Blocker that helps monster Sheltering in the tile.


(No Human Attack can be made against Monsters in that Position Again).

Second Roach Rule: Notice the greasy substance that appears when you move closer to a Roach.


You cannot move from a Greased tile to another Greased Tile.

Notice that Melee and ranged attacks do much more damage if the attack is not frontal.


Backstabbing a monster is the cream of the crop!!

IMPORTANT: Kill The Small roaches first or the mother roach may become too strong to be Faced Off!!


Just shoot from the corresponding direction.

TIP: Roaches attack timer is temporarily delayed immediately after hitting a barricade.

 
Use it to run away from them or to melee attack them without getting a counter attack.


(Notice the Big Claw as an Indication of Attack Readiness)

Be Careful with the red Roaches! They Spawn Attack Blockers once attacked.


Try to kill them first!


Hint: Use the Roach to the East for Studying.

Notice That once a Roach Baby is Killed, a 


message is shown saying that Hero attack vs roach has increased by 40%


And Roach Attack vs Hero has Decreased by 40%.


Killing Roach babies early is vital!

TIP: Stepping in the backside zone of a roach temporarily disables its attack timer.


Use it to run away from them or to melee attack them without getting a counter attack.
Be careful! This Roach has a very strong Attack!

Tough Challenge Ahead!


Only for the Pros!

Ouch! I've never seen a tree this tall.

It's immense!

This place can't possibly be Earth.

My diary: I never believed that phrase that says that "Humans are social beings, bla bla bla", 

and can die if left alone for too long. 

But now I think I'm beginning to feel the consequences of being stranded for too long.

I Just want to go home...

Life in the wilderness can quickly test your limits!
This is the Stitches Token. Step on it to gain the corresponding number of stitches.
Each stitch counts against you: every time you make a wrong move, bumping into an obstacle, arrow, or other hazard, 
your HP will be reduced by the total number of stitches you currently have.
(Check your total stitches in the lower-left corner of the screen.)
In NEO, you can push objects over mud horizontally or vertically.
…and even diagonally!

But here's another cool trick: the Slide Push!
Move diagonally toward a muddy object, and it will slide along the wall.

Note: The slide won't work if there is a symetrical fork with two open path, like in the example on the left.

You need JUST ONE free space for the slide to happen.
Objects can be Pushed over Arrows with no impunity.

Important: Arrow Slide Push Technique:


You can Push an object positioned over an arrow TOWARDS Arrow direction!


Condition: Kade needs to be facing the same direction as the arrow Does.

Push the Mine to the north with Kade facing East to see what Happens.

My diary: As the days goes by, I'm slowly recovering the memories of my past life. 


I just wonder the reason why I ended up here in this weird place...
The Lever Can Block the path as well as the Wheel.
As a General Rule, Arrows DO NOT Block Pushed objects in NEO.
My diary: Give me a Lever, and I can move the World!

As soon the job is done, you feel like Rambo! huhulll

My diary: 
I wonder how many others have lost their way here.

A dead body might at least show me what a human face looks like after so long.. Creepy...
My diary: Shadows stretch longer than they should… the sun doesn’t seem right here.
