This is the feared Scorpion!

Scorpions only move immediately after you.
Notice that They will remain in place indefinitely until you make a move.

The Scorpion is a slow-paced monster designed for puzzle lovers.


If you prefer more action, you can select a different quest on the Navigation Map.

This is a save point. Step on it and press R to restart from here.
If you need to restart again, press Enter to open the dialog, then press R from there.
Try it now!

Important: Use the X key to wait instead of moving.


You´ll remain in place while Scorpions make a move.

Choose your weapon!

Watch out for Hero's Facing Direction before Facing the Scorpion.

If there's too much information in the Cube:


PRESS RControl Key to Adjust the Zoom Level.


HOLD RControl Key for a second to Activate STUDY MODE!


(Zoom Out + Hide Vegetation Layer).

Sometimes you can get Stuck By taking monsters behind Arrows!


If you want (or need) to restart the session again:


1) Press Enter to open the Dialog.

2) Press R Key.


Try it now!

Life is hard in the wilderness…

In some quests, the number of arrows or sword attacks may be limited.

(Check the number of collected bonuses available in your inventory at the bottom-left of the screen).

Learn this game rule: The Hero moves and Attacks before Monsters do.


In Order, this is what quickly happens in a single Turn:


1) Hero Moves.

2) Hero Attacks.

3) Monsters Move.

4) Monsters Attack.
IMPORTANT: Pickuped Bonuses like ammo can only be used in the same Cube they were found at.

If you step on multiple save points, you can use the mouse to choose which one to restore from.
Save multiple times in this cube and then test it by clicking with the mouse.

Important: As soon as you start a new session, after opening the initial gate, you can Quickly find Puzzle entrance by pressing "\" Key.


Try this now!


Beware that it may cost some energy!

(Charged once per Cube)

Is this getting too hard? Choose another quest!


NEO is an Open World Game!
Notice that Kade can Block Monsters with His Sword.

My Diary: When a place is too Harsh for survival, it's Commonly said that that Place is a "Scorpion Valley" as an Expression.


This Happens due to the fact that Scorpions are always the last Creatures to Die in a Difficult Enviroment.


That's How this place Should be called...

This is a Firewand: When Picked Up, Casts a Fireball Towards Hero Moving Direction.


Fireballs Follow Hero Movent and can be used for Attacking Monsters.

Fireballs can Fly over Water tiles but Are Destroyed if they Stop over one. 


Study the two cases above....
Pick up the Boomerang on the Ground to Cast a Boomerang Towards hero Facing Direction.
Notice that Boomerangs cannot be Thrown Diagonally.

IMPORTANT: Move against Boomerang Flight Direction to Call it back to you.


Use this strategy to make curves and reach hard spots!

Example: A Northbound Flying Boomerang can be Called Back a Southbound movement.


(Southwest or Southeast works as well)
TIP: You can use Orbs to Rebound a returning Boomerang.

When you call back a Boomerang, it is automatically Rethrown towards Hero Facing Direction.


Note That a Boomerang cannot be Rethrown Backwards. (Only Laterally)


Warning: No Diagonal Rethrowing Allowed!

Notice that the next Boomerang has 4 Units.


It means it can kill 4 monsters in a single throw before it is destroyed!

In NEO, Monsters can roam in Groups!


These are Called "Compound Monsters".
Once you hit a Compound Monster, new Babies are spawned in the Corresponding Tiles.
Notice that you need free space for spawning, Otherwise no attack is made!

This scorpion has a baby in his left side.


Once you hit him, the baby will be spawned in the according position.


(Indicated by mud tile)

Important: Scorpions can spawn babies up to 2 tiles away,


If the neighbor tile is not empty, Spawning can jump one tile away.


In this case, the baby will be spawned jumping the forest tile. (over mud).
Two babies now! and two jumping Spawnings as well...

Eight Babies!


Notice that only the baby located in the mother's back will not be Jump Spawned.

To kill a Spider, just step over it.


(no Ammo required)
Don't forget you can use Wait key (X) for proper timing...

My Diary: It seems that, when I kill a Spider, a greasy substance coming out from 
the Carcass fills up the surroundings with a strange smell...


It scares away other creatures, but not for too long.


I think I can take advantage of it...


(Remember: You're invulnerable while killing Spiders)

Notice the Difference Between Compound Scarabs and Compound Spiders:


Babies around Spiders Rotate AROUND THE MOTHER as she turns around to face the Hero.


Babies around Scorpions always remain in the same relative position.


Now walk around these Compound Monsters to study each case.
These Baby Scorpions Always remain to the EAST and WEST position relative to YOU.
These Baby Spiders Always remain to the EAST and WEST position relative to THEIR MOTHER.
Fixed Position: Three Babies remain located in YOUR back row.
Three Babies revolving around the MOTHER'S back row.

Compound Monsters can also carry resources!


(Don't forget you need an empty tile for Spawning!)
Compound Scorpion: Resource remain in the same relative position.

Another Important Difference:


Compound Scorpions can Spawn Objects TWO tiles away from the mother Scorpion (JUMPING) while Spiders can only Spawn Objects around her.
Now test your skill fighting these Compound Monsters!

Monsters can also Walk Suspended over Forest Tiles!


Beware they can still attack from up there!

Pick up the Bone in the ground Straight ahead.


It'll throw a Bone towards the Scorpion, Crippling him!


Important: Proceed WITHOUT Stepping any Mud tile.

Important: A Crippled Monster ONLY MOVES if the hero is in the SAME LINE with him!


Notice that even Though the Scorpion is Awake, he Does not Move if you don't get Aligned to him.


(Keep avoiding mud tiles)
Notice that you can traverse Diagonally between mud tiles without attracting his attention.

You can pass through the Alcove to the north Since Monster's sight is blocked!


(Notice that the water tile does not block his sight)

1) Pick up the Bone Before Waking Up the Scorpion.


2) Align the bone with the Scorpion and make a Move towards him to throw the bone and Cripple him.


3) Now he is Crippled! Go grab that Sword!

My Diary: 
Scorpions also seems to roam in flock!

Since I can only attack one at a time, I´ll probably 
need to kill them from distance until I have only one remaining.


Also, I figured that I can use my sword to block these creature´s Movement. That´s quite handy...

Welcome to the Gates Tutorial!

The yellow object you see is a gate.
The round red object is an orb.

Step in front of the orb to see what happens…

The blinking sign over this orb is called a Key.

Every time you frontally strike an orb with a key on it, any gate in the same cube with the same key type will switch its state:

Open to Closed

Closed to Open

Same situation, but now the gates are on opposite sides.

Pay attention to the symbols!

Kade is walking with bare hands…
That means he has no arrows!

Let’s find some.
(Check the arrow count in the lower-left corner of the screen)

Notice that monsters are quite agile and can pass through fire.
To burn a monster, leave it on the fire for more than a second
(by blocking its way out).

Monsters cannot attack while on fire.
You can use Kade's body to block them over firepits.

When struck, Orbs also affect ANY NEIGHBOR COLORED key.


if the key color is yellow, the gate state will be switched to the oposite state.

if the key color is green, the gate just opens.

if it´s red, it just closes.


Experiment with the 3 orbs here to see what happens.
Yellow: Switches.
Red: Closes.
Green: Opens.
Kade: Hmm… the burning smell’s not that bad when you’re as hungry as I am right now.
Any arrow located in a tile that is NEIGHBOR to a key can also be activated or deactivated.

These are Platforms.

Just Play with them a bit.


Be careful not to get stuck!
They leave quite a big hole behind...

This is a platform group. 


They form a group if they are connected.
This is another group...

This last group has a Key over it.


Drop down the entire group to activate this key.

These are two types of Platforms available in NEO.
Platform walking is an art!
In this Quest, we’ll only cover the basic principles.
It goes much further than that...
This first type gives you unlimited steps and free exiting.

In the second, more complex type, you can only exit the platform group in the same direction you entered. 

Notice the arrow showing the exit direction.

In this second type you also have a limited number of steps to cross the pit. 

Notice the number showing how many steps remain.
Now try to exit the middle area safely. If you get stuck, press R to restart.
Stop and think before proceeding!

My Diary: As an Observation, I would like to point that Flying Rafts Moves Differently than Water Rafts.


Must be due to the Water Stream...

My Diary: When these monsters fall into the Abyss, I can't even hear them hit the bottom.
It must be really deep!
TIP: A Quick move will drop monsters down the Abyss.

Vines connected to a Firepit will spread the flames.

IMPORTANT!
Remember the Sharpest Angle Rule:
"When fire reaches a fork, it always follows the sharpest angle".

In this case, it goes North instead of continuing West.

In this case, it goes South.
The Sharpest Angle Rule strikes again!

Now we have a parallel bifurcation with two equal angles.

In this case, the fire will spread both ways.

Also note that vines of different colors are not affected by the spreading fire.

As you can see, orbs connected to vines are struck when fire reaches them.

Notice that vines need to be connected to objects to affect them.

In this case, the fire won't spread because there is no connection to the firepit.

The orb below is not connected either.

This one is connected, so fire spreads!

Notice that vines of different colors can be ignited by the intermediary firepit.

Finally, the connected orb will be struck as well.

Pickup Vine Bale objects to spread vines as you move through the Cube.

Reload a few times and experiment with Vine Bales until you feel comfortable to proceed.

TIP 1: Step on a tile with only one vine type to expand that color.
TIP 2: Keep an eye on the number showing your remaining spreading steps.

TIP 1: Use symmetrical bifurcations to your advantage.
TIP 2: Watch out for burning vines on rafts!

My Diary: What frightens me most about these endless pits isn't the cold wind or the eerie noises…
…it's the unexplainable musty smell rising from deep within.
My diary: It seems that the pouring rain from the last days have left quite a good amount of mud in the vicinity.

TIP: Mud Alter gameplay in a variety of ways.

 In this cube it limits your rotation ability severely.

TIP: You can check mud's effect in the current cube in the upper left part of the screen.

(step in a mud tile before that)

My diary: This gate has a hole in the shape of a fish that may be a keyhole for opening it. 


It looks like those ancient civilization sacrifice ritual things.

Weird...

As Long as You have at least 1 Unit of Corn in your Inventory, 

You can use it to lure Fish to the desired Position Indicated by the Mark.

My diary: I´ve noticed that the fish seems to avoid at all costs swimming below the raft.


It looks like they´re afraid of the noise it makes because of the waves.

 
Maybe I can use the rafts to restrict fish swimming area...

My diary: I managed to create some traps to restrain fishing swimming area.


It may be easier to catch them if the area is smaller.


(move the hook over the traps to switch their state)

Water Traps can also be Triggered by the Frontal mark.


(At Least 1 unit of Corn Required)

Welcome to the Herbs Introduction!


Herbs are very important to ensure Kade´s survival while stranded in this place.

First Rule, Herbs can be moved either:


1) - by bumping against it.


2) - by moving towards it.


Be careful not to get stuck here, or you´ll have to restart the quest.
Second Rule: By Default, herbs can only move orthogonally. (Not Diagonally)

Third Rule: Match 3 Herbs to get a bonus herb.


Bonus herbs can be used to open gates.


(Check the number of bonus herbs gained at the bottom left part of the screen)
Herbs always stop if there´s a match of 3 or more herbs, regardless of the color.

Now try to leave this inner area using the basic rules mentioned before.


Remember that you do not need to replay this cube next time. It´s only a tutorial.

3 different color herb match. 

Herb stopped!
Tip: Every extra herb beyond the third herb added to the matching group provides an extra herb as bonus.

TIP: Remember that herbs stop when kicked between 2 neighbor

herbs located to the North and south or east and west positions.

Important: If this is the first time you´re playing this Quest, 

proceed to the cubes 4 and 5 for an introductory tutorial first.


As soon as you finish them, try to get as much herb matches as you can in the first three cubes.


They are randomly generated!!! (Unlimited Gameplay)
TIP: Gray Herbs cannot match and thus, do not give any kind of bonus.

Gray herb Tutorial Area: There´s no need for replaying this every session.


Just try to leave this maze for learning purposes.

Rules:


1) - Herbs can only move over Mud tiles.


2) - If an herb is kicked out of the "mud pool", it becomes Gray.


3) - A gray herb cannot match with another gray herb.



Now, Kick these herbs out of the mud pool.
Since Gray herbs become useless, the hero can step on them freely...

Strategy Tip: Gray herbs can be used to block the path for another herb.


Now try to match the 3 herbs to open these gates using this strategy.


Be careful, or you´ll have to start the quest over again!

TIP: Remember that herbs stop when kicked between 2 neighbor

herbs located to the North and south or east and west positions.

Diagonal Herbs Ability Tutorial:


This herb can also be kicked Diagonally.


Try to proceed through this make for learning purposes.
Practice Diagonal kicking here!

Match these herbs to open the gate to the north.


Be careful not to get stuck!

Important: Notice that you can transfer the Diagonal ability to a neighbor normal herb.


Bump against these herbs to the north to see it for yourself.
Test the Diagonal ability transfering trying to open the next gates!

Pick up this perk to upgrade your fishing Gear level.


Click the Fishing perk Icon for more information.

Tip: These Fish are a real tough catch!!


Evolve your Fishing Skills before trying to face them.

Fishing Hook Merging:


1) - There are 2 types of hooks, The main hook (White) and the secondary hooks (darker ones).


2) - Get two hooks of the same size close to each other to merge them.


3) - Merge a secondary hook with the main hook to permanently upgrade it. (Level up)


4) - Secondary hooks have just a fraction of the main hook power.

Tip: Check the Fishing Perk for more fishing skill information:


Power: Means how fast the chance percentage grows when the hook is over a fish.


Speed: Hook movement speed in tiles per second.


Hook Radius: The bigger, the easier it gets to target fish.


Hook radius also influences the blue "Bulls eye" 2x power bonus.

Advanced hook Merging:


1) - There are 3 Hook Sizes: Small, medium and Large.

(Main hook is Large Sized).


2) - Only hooks of the same size can be merged.


3) - The more you merge hooks before the final merging with the main hook, 
the bigger are the Level bonuses you get from it!



Every Large merging adds +1 to the final merging bonus.


Every Medium merging adds +2 to the final merging bonus.


Every Small merging adds +3 to the final merging bonus.

Important Strategy for fighting Against Slime Monsters:


Slime has a soft jelly body that cannot stop arrows, So multiple monsters can be damaged while aligned.


On top of that, this gelatinous substance poisons the arrow, providing cummulative attack bonuses for every 
consecutive monster hit by a shot.


It Looks easy now, but the fight is going to get harder and every strategy learned may be valuable in the future.


Notice the increased Attack Damage inflicted to these aligned Slime Monsters.

My Diary: I have discovered a new strategy to fight these greasy nasty critters:


I think I´ll call it the "Slime Lure" Trick!!!


1) - Every time I step around a slime, It looks like I end up "enraging" them.

2) - An Enraged (RED) Slime tends to keep moving straight for a certain time.

3) - I need to quickly leave this creature´s surrounding to keep it going straight.

4) - Any obstacle found in his way seems to bring him back to normalty.

5) - Barricades Can be Destroyed using this Strategy.


Attacks Have Been Disabled so you can train this strategy here.

TIP: Backstabbing a Slime that´s just been lured can do massive damage!

Notice that in this quest the melee attack needs a few second to refresh after being used over again.


As soon as Kade has the sword in his hands, you´ll be ready for the next hit.

My Diary: I have developed another strategy to fight these greasy nasty critters:


Backstabbing!


Since I can direct their movement direction, if I Quickly surround them, not stepping front or sideways, 
I can manage to make a big amount of damage dealt with my knife by attacking them from the rear.


Notice that Melee attack is also available in this quest.

Compare Ranged x Melee attack power.


And Finally: Do not leave this Quest Without knowing how to Backstab Slimes. 

(it is Vital for your survival).

Train Your Backstabbing ability here!


Tip: Try to avoid the common error of stepping in the slime´s side tile while he´s enraged.


this will make his direction change towards Kade over again.

My diary: Murphy´s Law: 


Why do Your Nose start itching everytime You´re surrounded by a horde of dangerous scarabs?


I need to Sneeze...
Step on them!

My diary: It seems impossible to shot at these tiny monsters!!

 Besides having a small size, they´re also quite agile...

My Diary: These Creatures can also roam in group! 


It seems that  the only way to Kill them when they´re in two is taking them to a position that has a free spot behind them.
TIP: Plan your strategy before Advancing!

3 or more Adjacent Level 1 Spiders Merge into a Higher Level Spider.


Beware that to kill a High Level Spider you need to have free Room for all the Small spiders around her.
Be quick killing them or they'll Attack you!
Now you know why spiders are called the "Puzzle Beast".

After Stepping A High Level Spider, remaining Small Spiders Can Merge Back if there's 3 or more of them Neighboring each other! 


Kill them all in a single run to avoid it!

A castaway is nothing without a raft, right?


In NEO, Rafts can be customized in endless ways:


-You can attach a raft containing an orb to open doors.

-You can equip your raft with weapons or towers to help you with your fighting.

-You can use them as a transport medium for resources.

-You can even attach special modules to them like rudders, 
sails or Anchors to help you with navigation.


There´s plenty of different types of modules already available 
allowing youself to build the most powerful sailing machine for open seas venturing!
My Diary: I've built a Pickaxe so I can start mining these rocks.

Hint: This Pickaxe provides the Mining Points (MP) needed for ore mining.

(Your available MP is shown in the lower-left corner of the screen.)

Be careful: if you run out of MP, you'll have to restart the quest.

If you run out of Mining Points, you'll need to start over:

1 - Press Enter to open the dialog.
2 - Press R.

Try it now for practice and learning purposes!
Notice that Every Mining Attempt costs at least 1 Mining Point.
By default, Every hit has 50% of chance to succesfully destroy a mine.

TIP: Bump against the Hook to connect it to the square shaped rock.


Warning: Don't pull the lever until the rock is connected to the chain or you'll have to restart.
You can Push Ore Mines over Mud.

Pushing is Always a Priority!

If no Pushing is Allowed, Kade will attempt to break the mine with his pickaxe.

Important: You can either Kick or Push a hook to another tile.
1) Kick: Bump against the hook while facing it. 
Kicked hooks will slide until they hit a blockade.

2) Push: Bump the hook without facing it. 
It will move only to the neighboring tile.

Now, rotate toward the hook (north) and try to kick it.

Notice the two small Rings near the hook:


They indicate how many turns you can still kick or push it.

Now practice both Kicking and Pushing using the hooks above.


Pay attention to the remaining steps available and how it depletes.

Try to economize Mining Points as much as you can.


Mining is an Economy Game.

After hitting a Rock with your Pickaxe, You rotate towards that rock position.


If the Rock is Successfully destroyed, you also move to that position too.


Plan your move before doing that or a monster behind the Rock can attack you.

This Square Mine Has a Major Drawback:


If you hit it in the Corners, It'll Cost You 3 Mining Points Instead of 1.

TIP: Bump Against the mines to The Left from every direction.


The red Text will show you the required Mining Points For each Angle.

TIP: Mine orientation is randomized on every session. 


(Unlimited Replayability)

The Default chance for a Rock to be Destroyed is 50%.
Unless there's a Percentage indicating a Custom Destruction Chance for certain Rocks.

My Diary: I tried to talk to a crab today. He walked away sideways...
At least someone around here has direction. haha.

This is the Double Mine.


Try to Hit it as close as possible to the ore indicator located in both the sides for just 1 MP as Cost.


Be Careful: Side Hits can Cost as much as 5 MP!
Experiment with these mines from every direction to check Pickaxing Costs.
There's a tutorial for this new feature, the "Swapper Tool", in the Mining II Quest.

This tutorial only covers the basic Mining Mechanics.


In Short, Mining is all about getting as deep as you can to get the rarest minerals you can.


Try to get as far as possible in this cave...


Advanced mining, wich will be covered in the next maps, can be turned into a sofisticated intellectual challenge.


Stay tuned!
Moving the Hook over mud tiles is free of charge.
Connecting a Hook to a neighbor mine is also always free.

This is the Directional Mine: Much harder than the others to be Ored.


TIP: Bump Against the mines to the right from every direction to check Pickaxing Costs.

TIP: You can Choose Wheel mine connection By rotating the hero towards 
Desired Direction and Then Bumping Against the Wheel Mine.

Once you Choose, Connection Becomes Permanent.

Try it Now!

Adjacent Hooks Can Always be Merged.

You don't need extra Hook Steps for that.
Notice that Hooks Steps Are Added when you merge them!
You Cannot Connect a Chainless Hook to a mine.
Kicking a Chainless Hook won't Merge it or Connect to any Target Mine.

This is a Vault!

Vaults provides you Bonuses, but they Always ask for something in Exchange...


Notice the text: The first line is a Condition that should be met in order to get the Bonus Mentioned in the second line.

Important: You NEED to Activate Vaults before it starts Counting Data.


To Activate a Vault, just step around it.

Some Vaults Can make things harder!

This one can inflationate Costs for every failed attempt.

Notice the cost increasing as you fail...

Keep in mind that the Extra cost applies only FOR THE SPECIFIC DIRECTION you're attempting to break that Rock.

If price get's too high, try out another angle or even another path.
This Vault Allows Collected Mine Bags to Increase the Amount of Pickaxes Earned in the Cube.
Notice the Indicator around Pickaxes showing the Bonus.

This Vault Gives Extra Bonus for the Item Indicated when you pick it up.

Notice the Green Text Showing the Current Amount Of Bonuses Provided by Vaults.

This Vault gives Interest for the indicated item (Pickaxe).

Whenever you Gain a Pickaxe, Inventory amount is multiplied by the Interest Total %.

This is the Wedge!

A Highly efficient tool that provides valuable help in your Mining Activities.


Notice how you can change its orientation While walking around it.
The Wedge can be used to push a group of rocks Sidewards.
Most importantly: Notice the Wedge's Blade Angle to Figure out the direction Rocks will be pushed towards.
If there's no free space for the last rock to be pushed to, that rock will be destroyed!

Notice that there are two types of Wedges, each one pushing objects to Opposite directions.


The small green or red Stamped Arrow icon over them indicates its type.


Try to figure out how Similar and Different wedges work together here.

Notice the number indicating the number of remaining uses for each wedge.


If it reaches zero, it'll get grayed out and become useless.


Important: Wedge counter only decreases when it pushes a Row of Rocks WITHOUT any Wedge rocks in it.


A Wedge pushing another Wedge, even if it is Contained in a line of different kinds of Rocks, is Always free.

Important: Notice that you can Invert Wedge Type by bumping it against Tall Tiles.


Tall tiles are Tiles that are "Tall", like Forest, Walls, etc.

Use the Wedges below for practicing.


Once you're ready, try to get all the Arrows in the cube as a Challenge.

TIP: Gather two wedges of Different type together and you can freely push them to an empty tile for 1 move point.


If you move them away from each other, it'll cost nothing!


Notice the "Push Away" sign Indicating that wedge can be pushed.
Notice that one step point will be charged as you push these rocks.

But now, you have another Wedge in the group of Rocks that will be pushed.


Nothing will be charged in this case!

Pushing a group containing a wedge is always free.


Now try to use what you've learned to pass this area.

Two Different neighbor wedges: Notice the "Push Away" meaning you can push them to an empty tile.


Notice that the last Push is Free, since you're pushing them AWAY from each other!


You'll still keep one step remaining in this case.
Even a Grayed out Wedge containing zero steps can still be pushed AWAY for free from its pair.
TIP: Bump the Hero against a wall tile to Change All Hero Neighbor Wedge Types.

This is the Dynamite Tool.

Simple Rule: When you Bump Against it, If there's a Mine Behind, It'll Slide to it...

Otherwise, It will Explode!!!

Second Rule: Two Or more Adjacent Dynamites Expand Explosion by one tile each side.

Notice the two extra Explosions over the two Muddy Tiles.

For Last: If there are other tools like Dynamites over mines, Bumped Dynamite will slide to the the first free spot Available.

(The last mine to the left in the next case).

Notice that some Rocks may be Placed inside a Hole.

Step around the Hole and Swing your Character.


Note that a Rope Sign Appears around it.

Whenever You destroy a Rock inside a Hole, the Rock that is rope connected Slides down to it.

Lone Rocks like this one Cannot be Destroyed.


Rocks inside Holes Require Rope Conection to be Destroyed.

Important: While there are two or more Lever Mines Connected,

you can choose the Active "Puller" by Bumping against the Lever mine.


Learn this trick to pass this cube.


Active "Puller" is indicated by the glow effect shown when Kade is near a lever.

Step by step: 


1) Pull the lever until connection.

2) Have 2 or more Lever mines connected.

3) Bump against the Lever Mine. 

4) Notice the Active puller switched to the other mine.
(Indicated by glow effect).

5) Choose the left mine and pull the same lever again. 


(Notice that the other mine, the active Puller, pulled the chain towards it's Direction)

If There's a Small Rope Icon Over a Mine, it Means it is "Rope Connected".


A Rope "Connected Mine" Can have its Position Swapped with the Mine Located Behind it.
Bump Against The Mines to the East To Have their Positions Swapped.

Notice the Stretched Rope indicating it can be Swapped.


In this case it can be Swapped only Once because only the frontal Mine is Rope Connected.
This one cannot be Swapped Because The Rope Connected Mine is behind the Frontal Mine.

Use this Group of Mines to study which cases Swapping is Allowed.


The Stretched Rope Indicator only appears when you are Neighboring the Mine.

Important: You Can Only Destroy A Rope Connected Mine if There's no Other Mine Behind It.


Notice that Mine Swapping is Free of Charge and can be done Anytime.

This is The Unitary Mine: It Works Similarly to the Directional Mine, but is cheaper.


Mining Costs Only increase by 1 point from the frontal ore to the back.


That´s Why it's called the Unitary Mine.


Use the Mines to the Right for Price Comparison.
Unitary Mine: Made of a Softer kind of mineral. Cheaper Cost.
Directional Mine: Made of a Harder kind of mineral. More Expensive.

This Object over the Rock is the Swapper Mining Tool.

Face South and Bump Against it.

A Cool Trick:

If there's no Mine Behind the Swapper, it Becomes Green.

Once Bumped, a Green Swapper Will Jump TWO Tiles to the 
Direction Pointed by the Hero to another Mine, if that Mine Exists.
If there's another Tool over the Jumping Target, Both the Tools will have their Positions Switched.
This Vault Enables the Alcove Rock Pushing Ability.

Rule: Whenever there is ONLY ONE EMPTY position around a Rock, That Rock will be Pushed for free to 
that void Tile Instead of being Destroyed by the Pickaxe.

This is a Ladder.

Use it to Climb to Higher Grounds.
Ladders have Limited Entrance and Leaving Angles.
You can use Collected Bridge Wood to build Bridges!

But there's a restriction:

You can Only Expand the Bridge by One Tile.

Sometimes, building from both sides may be a good idea...

Important: Longer Bridges can be built following one rule:

The Bridge Maximum Lenght is Defined by the Sum of Connected Base Points, Counting from the Closest Base.

Notice the 3 Base points of the bridge to the East, indicated by 3 Round Rocks.

They allow you to build the third and last connection to the other side.

Note that: 3 Base points allows you to build a 3 tiles long bridge.

As you build the Bridge, notice the red indicators "+1" showing the Bases.

The green text is your closest base, Where bridge lenght starts counting.

This is the Tunnel!
Use it to Fast travel Around the cube.

As You step the Tunnel tile, your exit point will be the next Tunnel that is in the same line to your Movement Direction.


Important: Before that, Rotate the Hero towards the Direction you want to Exit to as you Leave.


The Exit Tile should not be Blocked!

You cannot Access the Rightmost tunnels.

Nearby Tunnels cannot Connect to them below water or Deep Pits.

When exiting Tunnels, you only have two options
(in order):


1) -Hero Facing Direction

2) -Hero Back Direction


Test the second option now:

Step the mud tile facing North and enter the tunnel.

Notice that the hero will try to Exit towards the North (Yellow gate).

Since it is blocked, he will leave towards the South. (His Back tile).

Tunnels need not to be Perfectly Aligned for your to travel between them.


You can use the "L" Tunnel Trip Technique:


Just face North and see Kade walking down in the underground in an "L" Shape.


(Notice the vegetation patches indicating his travelling path).
Remember: Black Pit and water will block your "L" trip down below as well.

You can Use Tunnels to mine from Distance.

The Pickaxe will Destroy any Rock found in the Exit.

Notice the small Hammer over that mine: That's a "Hammer Mine".

Rotate the Hero Around A Hamer Mine and See that there's a Secondary Target Indicator Across it.

When you Successfully Attack a Hammer Mine Both the Hammer Mine and the Target Mine will be Destroyed.

The Cost for that will be the Smaller one considering the two Attacked Mines.

Try to Spot the Best Attack Angle to find at least one mine that will cost 1 Point to be destroyed.

You'll be Destroying two Rocks for the price of one Pickaxe!

Now you only have 3 Points. Only 3 hits to pass this area!

You need 3 single point hits.
When the Hero is Suspended, He will Kick Muddy Rocks Instead of Pushing them.

To get Vault Points, Simply Destroy mines inside the Vault 3 tiles Radius.

The closer the mines are from the Vault, the bigger rewards get.
You can also Push Away Mines from Vault's Vicinity to get more points.

In NEO, you can step on a couple of different height levels.

Besides the Underground, which is accessed by tunnels, you can use stairs to climb to the Second or third Floors.
Notice the "F3" message Ahead indicating you've entered the top Floor.

Important: You can still Access Tunnels from to floors, following one rule:


Trips can Only happen Between Identical FLOORS!


Floor 1 to Floor 1, Floor 2 to Floor 2, and so on...

You can use Bridges to connect third floor to second floor and vice -versa.

Notice that Third floor Bridges are Brown darker.

This is the Sticky Mine!


Any Close Step and it'll move towards you.

Important rule:

If two or more Sticky mines try to move to the same Position, NONE of them will do.

Notice the "Block" sign, indicating that multiple mines tried to move to that position.

Those mines will be blocked in that turn.

This is the "Chisel Mine".

Play around with the Chisel Below to learn how it works.

Just Rotate and Bump against it...

The Most useful Chisel Ability is to Fetch other Mine Tools near your position.

Try to Bring both the ropes to the Right for you to use.

Pay special attention to the Mine Behind the Chisel

(linked to the three ropes).

That's the position where the Fetched Tool will be Brought to.

If You Bump Against a Chisel that Doesn't have free space to Slide through, It will be Destroyed.

Plus: Destroy a Chisel to get any Bonus Surrounding it for free!

Notice the Difference Between the two Sticky mines Below:

The Slime is Rotating in the One to the Right side.

Rule: If there's a mine with ONLY One Tool in the Adjacency, The Slime Starts Rotating.

Bump Against the Sticky Mine and see it Suck the Tool for Itself.

This is The Jumper Tool!

Face North and Bump Against it...

The Jumper Gives you ONE Jump Across a Group of Rocks.

Notice How you Affect it's rotation by rotating around it.

Use Rotation to Choose Jump Direction and Bump against the Jumper and Voila!

You'll be in the other side!

Two Rules:


1) - You need to have a Rock in front of you. 

2) - You can't Jump over the Bumped Jumper.


Green Jumper: Jump Available.

Yellow Jumper: Jumper will be pushed.


Notice how you cannot jump to the mud tile to the right, since you'll be using that jumper.

Jumpers are pushed the same way as Dynamite.

Use these jumpers to Learn how it Works.

The will also Slide to find empty slots like Dynamite as well.
This is the Arrow Mine. Notice how it rotates as you move Kade near it.

Rotate the Arrow until it Gets Yellow, connecting to another mine containing a Tool.

Bump Against the Arrow and the two Tools will be exchanged.

Notice the Rope Indicating the two mine are connected.
Notice the Arrow mine only switches the Tools while the Rope Switches The whole mines.

If the Arrow is Targetting an Empty Mine (with no Tools), it becomes GREEN.

Bump Against it and the Whole mine will try to move against the Arrow Direction.

For Memorization:

Green: Mine Moves.

Yellow: Exchanges Tools.

Red: Do nothing. (Mine can't even be Destroyed in this case)
If Kade or another mine is behind a pushed mine, they will be pushed too.

Meet the Cannon! It can Teleport Tools over Mines.

Face East and Bump against it to see what happens...

The Cannon work in a similar fashion to the Tunnel Travelling System.

Bump Against it towards a mine that contains a Tool.

Hero Direction Defines Target Destination.

Notice the two Shock FX Lines. They are the Cannon two main AXIS.

Each Axis is Allowed Only ONE jump over Empty tiles.

Position yourself in the mud tile facing North and Activate the Cannon.

Note that Each axis will be "Jumping" over Water Tiles Once.

Jumping Makes the Cannon a very powerful tool for Mining.

By Default, You Generally Use Hero Bump Direction and Hero Facing Direction as the first and second axis.

Note that you can also Invert the two Axis to form the "L" Shape.

If there's no Tool aligned towards Bump Direction, you can use Hero Direction to find a tool and use Bump Direction to define the target.

Face East or west to test this Inverse Technique above.

Also note that, if another Tool is found on the way, The'll switch places.

This is the Cog Mine.

Notice how Hero Direction Affects the system:
When you Bump against it, it Rotates the four Surrounding Objects in the indicated Direction.

Rotate the hero towards a Diagonal Direction and the Cog becomes Green.

Bump the Green cog to invert Rotation Direction.

This is The Glove Mining Tool: A good Candidate for the Most Versatile one.

Notice How it Rotates Following your Direction.

Bump to Slide it and Grab Another Tools.

Once you grab something, Bump another Mine and the Glove will bring that tool for you.
The Glove Can Jump Tiles, as long as they're not tall.
If there's a tool in the Target Mine, they will Both have their Positions Switched.

The Boulder is also a valuable tool for mining due to it's pushing power.

The Vault to the south maximizes it's pushing power to the limit.

Kade: So much work just for you!
You must be thinking you're too special...

My Diary, Three Basic Assumptions About this Place:


1)-Everything moves.


2)-Everything that moves wants to kill me.
3)-I'm Screwed...
Back Attacks = More Damage!

My Diary:


You know you´re in trouble when you want to scream but you can´t because if you scream...


...you may attract dangerous monsters!!!


Even my prefered stress relief techniche needs to be rethinked in this place...

These are Bulbs!

Use the Sword to interact with them.

Use the sword to Destroy Red Bulbs!

Just aim at them Precisely!


Caution: Avoid Hitting Green (Poisoned) Bulbs.

They will kill you!"

Blue Bulbs Will Give you protection agaist Spikes.

Use them to Traverse the cube towards north Direction.

This is the Feared Spider!!.

 Step Over it...

Timing is Crucial!

If the Spider Jumps over you, then you're gone.
TIP: Spider Blocks Arrows.

My diary: I've got good and bad news! 

First the good one: After all these days of fighting, It seems I've even improved my muscles size!

Bad news: Only Giant Insects in the area to show them off to! :)


(Need to Maintain good mood to alleviate Hunger)

My Diary:


So many spiders in my shelter.


BTW, What did mommy spider say to baby spider?

"-You spend too much time on the web".

My diary: The only one thing that prevents me from admitting I´m afraid of this place is...

 ...pride.

This is the Regular, Basic Level 1 spider.

Just step to kill...

This is a Level 2 Spider, Notice the Small Baby Spider Behind the Big Mother Spider.


After Killing the mother, the Baby is spawned in the tile where it's pointing to.

Be careful, A free tile for the Baby is required behind the Mother otherwise stepping is Blocked!


Think before waking up the mother spider or you may die!

Here's a Level 3 Spider.


Two new baby spiders are spawned now...
And two free spots are required at the corresponding positions in Order to kill the Mother as well..

These Spiders Have a Cocoon Around Them.


Cooconed Monsters will Block Your movement until all of them get Destroyed.

To destroy a Cocoon, Bump Against the Mother Spider Having a Blocking tile
(like Forest) in that position.

Here we have four Cocoons over 4 Forest tiles.


Just Bump to destroy them all.

Flat Tiles like water do not Break the Cocoon...


Be careful not to die Here!

As a general Rule, Try to Destroy all the Cocoons before Attacking The Mother Spider.


Remember: If you step on a Mother containing a Cocoon, a new Spider Similar to the Mother will be Spawn in that Position.

Almost Every Realtime Monster in NEO has his Counterpart: 

The Stepping Version Monster!


Both the versions are Generally Different, Carefully handcrafted for the best in each occasion.

Stepping Spiders Have some small Differences:

 
1) You're Immune to The First Attack Delivered by a Spider.

2) Only the Second Attack Will Kill you.

3) Step Away from a Spider to Become Immune once Again.

Notice the Green Slime around the Spider Indicating that the Next Attack is Fatal.


Once you see it, Step Away from that Spider to Clean it.


IMPORTANT: You Cannot Step Baby Slimed Spiders, They'll block your way and kill you!

You can only Step over Slimed Mothers so they can spawn new Babies.

The X Symbol means that the Corresponding tile can be of ANY TYPE.

It Does not Block Spider Stepping at all.


You cannot Burn the Mother Spider, only their Babies.

Challenge: Try to conquer this area entering from different routes.


This is the Easy Path.
This is the Intermediate Path.

This is the Hard Path.


Try to beat them All!

Notice the TIC TAC Noise.


While in TIC TAC mode, All monsters move at the same time.


PS: Notice that there's a Visual move indicator around the hero, as well.

The percentage number indicated by the mother Wasp indicates its spawning speed in comparison

 to the Hero´s Attack speed.  

A 50% rate means that the reposition rate is equals to one new wasp for 2 shots timespan.  


Try not to waste a single shot!

You can get attack speed bonus:



1) Most Importantly: Shooting while there are neighbor tiles occupied by wasps. 


(every neighbor wasp occupied tile gives you a cummulative attack speed bonus)



2) Having the most number of wasp occupied tiles in your hero´s shooting area (bow´s frontal row). 

(the more the better, the attack bonus is also cummulative)

3) Shooting Wasps over water.



4) Shooting from Platforms.

The reason for this quest is to provide a harder challenge to showcase how complex and advanced wasp fights can become.

 
The challenge is: Kill all the wasps in this cube before the boulders get you locked inside their alcoves. 


This is also a nice spot to study advanced wasp fighting strategies.


Warning: This quest is hard! You can come back later when you get more experienced...

TIP: Since you can gain bonuses for each neighbor wasp tile, 
you can use arrows to protect yourself from their attack while keeping the bonus.

TIP: Since you can gain bonuses for each neighbor wasp tile, 
you can use arrows to protect yourself from their attack while keeping the bonus.

Advanced Tactics: 


1) Body odor ability: A wasp that is 2 tiles away from the hero tends to move to his side. 
(use it to lure them to fire or water tiles)


2)

This is just for advanced players:

Fire has the same weight than any other tile for wasps when they´re choosing where to move to. 

Just lighinting a firepit doesn´t help that much because you´ll need to be lucky waiting for them to move over it.


Learn to use the Barricade Trap Strategy. memorize the Rules:


1) IMPORTANT: It Only works with both TOUCHED Barricades.

2) Wasps ALWAYS move from a barricade to a neighbor Barricade that is one unit bigger. That´s called: climbing./n
3) Wasps NEVER Move from a touched barricade to another smaller Touched Barricade.



Everytime a wasp "CLIMBS" To another one sized bigger barricade It receives a "climb point". 

(Showed by a green + sign).

Every Climb point increases the wasp affinity for fire tiles when movement is being sorted.


This strategy can be quite helful against powerful mother wasps.


Now try to explore this strategy on this Very difficult last cube.

Hint: This mine Gives you a Mining Bag.

As a bonus each bag increases the Mine Points Earned in the Cube.

Hint: As Said Before, Every hit has a 50% chance to succesfully destroy a mine.


Some Mines may present Custom Destruction Chance. 
(Indicated by the Mine).


TIP: Hit direction doesn´t affect the percentage.

Welcome to the fire Lesson! Fire plays an Important Role in NEO!
 
After picking Up the artifact in the Dome, A Firemaster perk icon will be added to the Perks Panel Below.

 
After that, step close to a firepit and start lighting them up.

A Quero quero can only be killed by headshots.


to trigger a headshot, you need to make a move or rotation move in the exact moment he is 

passing through the middle of the tile.


Also, never stay in front of them.
Boulders And pits

Here´s a Level 1 Spider, To kill it, just step over it in the right time. 
(Before it moves and attack you)

Here´s a Level 2 Spider. To kill it, you need an extra space for the back spider to be pushed towards. 

In this case, you would need a free tile indicated by the water tile behind it.

Here´s a Level 3 Spider. All minor Spiders needs a free tile in order for the central spider to be stepped over.

(water tiles indicates required free tiles)
Here´s a Level 4 Spider. All tiles indicated by water are required to be free before you can step over the main Spider.

Here´s a Level 5 Spider. All tiles around need to be free before you can step over the main Spider.


IMPORTANT: if after stepping over the main spider, any secondary spider is pushed over another spider, the last one gets an extra level.

Spider merging: 


Case 1: 3 Vertically or Horizontally aligned Level 1 spiders merge into a Level 3 spider.


(strike the orb to test it)

Spider merging: 

 
Case 2: 5 Spiders Forming a "plus" sign merge into a Level 4 Spider.

TIP: This is strictly a tutorial cube.


Above the water tile line there are some hints about Spider behavior.


Below it, there are some Puzzles to help your fighting against these beasts.

The challenge here is to kill them all inside their own alcoves!!


Note that killing the spiders in this room is optional, since you won´t get any prize for doing 
that over and over in the next gameplays.

finalize the adventure and click the image below to choose another Quest.

Mastering Hero Rotation is the key to efficient fighting.


Your rotation training starts here.

upgrade Stone Maximum Storage Capacity. 
Use it as soon as possible to avoid wasting your precious stones due to lack of storage space.

No more back and forth travelling, Yupee!

Conquer 30 Cubes to obtain it. Hover the goal for more info.

it consists not in

This Quest Allows you to Unlock the Training panel! 
By Training your abilities you can get better bonuses for conquering goals.

Just unlock "Training", then click the "Training" Button in the upper left and choose a goal to upgrade.

Welcome to NEO Farm!

Build a thriving village, grow crops, harvest, forge, fish, raise animals, craft powerful weapons, and level up your RPG skills!
Click Kade in the lower right to begin your adventure!

Your First Task: Pile up 4 or more resources!

Stand in front of stones and press Z or X to pick up or drop items.

Use C and V to rotate and face objects.
Click Kade when ready to continue!

Cool! 
Resource stacking and Moving is the heart of NEO Farm.


Click Kade Portrait to advance...

(You can also press enter to proceed to the next Objective)

Now try keeping only 2 piles of resources at the same time.

Hint: Use X (Wait) and Z (Special) to pick up or drop resources.

Awesome! 


Your farm is just starting to Grow!


Click Kade to advance...

To do anything in NEO Farm, you need a Blueprint!

Check the Blueprint panel in the lower right (yellow text).

Click it or press Page Up / Page Down to switch between Blueprints.

Objective: Switch active Blueprints 10 times!

Awesome! 


Now it's Time for your first building!


Click Kade Portrait to advance...

Objective: Build the Stone Storage Building.

Please read all the steps before proceeding:
1 - Choose the Stone Storage Blueprint in the Blueprint panel.
2 - Place resources on the ground matching the blueprint formation.
3 - The last resource placed defines the building’s location.
4 - Important: Leave as many free tiles (grass) around it as possible.

Cowabunga!
(Hover the mouse over the building, or place the hero in front of it for more info.)

Click Kade to advance…

Objective: Move all the Stones to the Storage

Hint: Use X (Wait) and Z (Special) to carry or drop resources.

Yippee!
You’re almost ready for your first fight!!

Click Kade to advance…

Objective: Build the Tool’s Building.

1 - Choose the Tool’s Building Blueprint in the Blueprint panel.
2 - Place resources on the ground matching the blueprint formation.
3 - The last resource placed defines the building’s location.

Success!
Hint: You can use wheelbarrows from the Tool’s Building to move buildings around your farm later.

Click Kade to advance…

Now press F2 and click "To the Forest" to start your first NEO fighting adventure.

As you gather more resources and unlock new blueprints, don’t forget to return to the farm to improve your buildings.

Objective: Get a Blueprint to upgrade the Stone Storage's maximum capacity at the farm.

You can obtain this Blueprint in the “Fire is my Best Friend” quest by completing all objectives.

Congrats!
Tip: Learn to deal with these little farm monsters. Each behaves differently.
Some can be pushed, others destroyed or kicked…
Click the Farm button and hover the mouse over their icons to learn more.

Don't let them block your way while you're working on your farm!

Objective: Choose a new Blueprint by clicking the “New” button (lower right).
A window will open to keep the old Blueprint or choose a new one.
Useful to reduce the energy cost of a Blueprint or select a working pattern.
If no “New” button is available for the Stone Capacity upgrade, get more Blueprints in the “Fire is my Best Friend” quest.

Congrats!

The green number on a Blueprint button shows how many of that type you have remaining.
You can get more by re-conquering them on the battlefield.

Important Hint: Try to collect several Blueprints before using them to reduce energy costs—energy is a valuable resource!

Click Kade to advance…

Objective: Upgrade your Stone Storage until it reaches a Maximum Capacity of 10.


(Blueprint Needed! - You can get one at the "Fire is my Best Friend" Quest ).


Upgrading is as easy as using a Blueprint for construction.

The only difference is that the building icon should Match with the Building Position.


So, Choose The upgrading Blueprint and position resources accordingly.

Congrats!

Important: Keep upgrading all buildings as soon as possible.
Resource wastage can be deadly in the wilderness…

Click Kade to advance…

Objective: Automate a Blueprint application

Click the “Auto” button to use a Blueprint automatically (no need to place items on the ground).

Important: All resources are needed, or the button will be disabled.

Congrats!

Automation requires Cogs, which you can earn by conquering goals.
The harder the goal, the more Cogs you get!

Click Kade to advance…

Objective: Build the Forge Building.

1 - Get a Blueprint in the “Mining I” quest.
2 - Select the Blueprint.
3 - Place resources on the ground matching the blueprint formation.
4 - Important: The last resource placed defines the building’s location.

Now try collecting minerals like Iron Ore and Coal so you can start forging!
You’ll also need recipes—look for the book icon in the Goals panel.

Click Kade to advance…

Objective: Build the Berry Building

1 - Get a Blueprint in the “Fishing I” quest.
2 - Select the Blueprint.
3 - Place resources on the ground matching the blueprint formation.
4 - Important: The last resource placed defines the building’s location.

Congrats!

Now try collecting some Berry Seeds so you can start planting!

Click Kade to advance…

Objective: Plant a Berry Bush!

1 - Get some seeds in the “Boulders” quest.
2 - Bump against the Berry Building until Berry Seed is selected as the building item.
3 - Grab a Berry Seed.
4 - Face a mud tile and press the Battle Key (Default: B).
5 - Wait for the plant to grow.
6 - Collect the berries and move them to the Berry Building using X and Z.

Congrats!

Now take the Berry Fruits to the Berry Building.

Click Kade to advance…

Objective: Move a building using Wheelbarrows

1 - Go to the Tool’s Building.
2 - Grab some Wheelbarrows.
3 - Check the required number of Wheelbarrows in the building info panel.
4 - Place the corresponding number of Wheelbarrows on a tile adjacent to the building you want to move.
5 - The building will be moved to that position.
6 - Bump against the building.

Congrats!

Proper building placement can be very useful for efficient farm management.

Objective: Build the Wood Cutter Building

1 - Get a Blueprint.
2 - Place resources on the ground matching the blueprint formation.
3 - Important: The last resource placed defines the building’s location.

Congrats!

Click Kade Portrait to advance...

Objective: Use the Wood Axe to Chop Down a Forest Tile

Steps:
1 - Grab the Wood Axe from the Wood Cutter Building.
2 - Aim at a forest tile in front of your character.
3 - Press the Battle Key (B by default) to use it.

Note: Chopping may take some time.

Congrats!

You have just increased your farm size!
Collect Farm Size Tokens to grow your farm even more.

Objective: Forge an Iron Bar

1 - Get a “Forge Iron Bar” recipe from Mining or other quests.
2 - Select the Forge Building by facing it from the front.
3 - Check how many Coal and Iron Ore items are required on the left panel.
4 - The produced item amount is shown on the right panel.
5 - Missing items are shown in red.
6 - Gather the required items if you don’t have enough.
7 - Click the big Cog image to start or stop production.
8 - Wait for the forging process to finish.

Tip: Get as many recipes as you can and start producing early!

Each production cycle consumes one recipe.
The book icon shows how many recipes you have available.

Objective: Upgrade a Recipe

1 - Face the building containing the recipe (Forge or Firepit).
2 - The upgrade price is shown on the Upgrade button.
3 - Red indicates a missing item.
4 - Hover the mouse over the Upgrade button to see the upgrade effect.
5 - If everything is ready, click to apply the upgrade.

Congrats!

Get recipes for the Firepit and start preparing Fish Meals.

It works the same way as in the Forge.
More tutorial quests will be added soon…

Hero can light firepit by adding a certain amount of wood to it.

the default, and most basic way is by stepping around firepits, but as more progress is made in the firemaster perk,

new ways of adding wood can also be unlocked.

Important: Initially, Wood placement is is only allowed in Virgin Areas.



Some Definitions: 


Regular wood:  Wood added by stepping around firepits.



Fire power: Damage taken by monsters over burning firepits Measured by a percentage of melee attack. 



Spread: This determines the maximum size a neighbor barricade needs to be for the fire to spread to it. 



Outarea: Number of outside area wood placement allowed per area. bump against a firepit to add/subtract outarea wood.



Wood needed:  The most important thing! Wood needed for fire ignition!



Pits: Hero gets a discount for the number of wood needed in the area/cube after lighting a certain number of firepits.



Star Bonus: Each 10 of this increases the amount of Stars gained by the hero by 1 per bonfire Lit.


Important:  in some maps, the amount of wood needed for fire lighting may increase as the hero continues to clear new areas.

This perk determines the capacity of the hero to use Barricades in his favor while fighting in the wilderness.


Monsters can destroy barricades of any size, while the hero needs certain abilities to do that.


Hero Barricade destruction:

In order for a hero to destroy a barricade, he needs to have a certain Barricade destruction level, (improved by collecting perks).



Touched Barricade: If a hero destroys at least one log of a barricade, it turns darker. this means this barricade has been touched!


The maximum barricade size that can be destroyed is determined by the Destroy barricade power (D#)  plus the sum of neighbor touched barricades. 



Hint: Place Kade facing a barricade to Check his Destruction power towards it. 


for example: a "D3 + 2" showed in the perk's icon means that the hero has a destruction power of D3 
plus two adjacent Touched Barricades that equals to D5.
Use NUMPAD Keys to move you hero. Rotate using C and V, and Press x to skip turn.

Use NUMPAD Keys to move you hero. Rotate using C and V, and Press x to skip turn.

Movement is restricted depending on the Character movement Level.


Collect movement perks to increase your movement level.

Here are some Definitions:



Tall Tiles: Forest, closed doors, walls, etc. Any tile that blocks the character and is "tall".



Flanked Tiles: Is a tile containing two Tall Tiles to the north and south, or to the East and West Direction.



Narrow Passage: for example: when the hero wants to make a NW move to a free tile, 

and there is a tall tile to his north and West position, the small gap between these two tall tiles is called the narrow passage.



Tunnel: A tile that has only two possible walking exits.



Dead End: A tile that has only ONE possible walking exits.

This Perk Regulates the capacity of the hero to explore new areas in the map.


Sub Perks:



Over Barricade Scout: Each level of this perk increases the ability of the hero to look over barricades by one unit size.



Show Resource Chance: Chance for a tile containing a bonus rune to be revealed.



Show Resource Neighbor Chance: This determines the chance for the neighbor tiles of a revealed rune to be revealed. 

Useful for checking if the resource is worth picking up.



Resource bonus calculation: the bonus provided by a picked up rune is equal to the amount of free tiles around it multiplied by the amount of water tiles or lit firepits.


Hint: Destroy Barricades around a resource to increase its bonus amount.



VERY IMPORTANT: Resource Timers decrease by 1 for each newly cleared area.
